Hello everyone! 
We’re in the final 24 hours of our campaign and, as of yesterday, we hit our additional voice acting stretch goal! We’re so excited that we get to have even more voiced lines from our stellar voice cast, and we’ll also be casting a few more actors to voice some of our more prominent side characters. This will include those who will be part of our ’No-Strings’ route, like Teddy the bartender who you can now gaze upon (and eventually kiss).

WE DID IT! Thank you so much to all of you for supporting us and spreading the word. We're so incredibly excited to get to bring this game to life and cannot wait to properly get to work in the new year. 
We still have a while to go in our funding cycle and really REALLY hope to meet that second stretch goal of more voice acting, so the party doesn't stop here, and we're revved up and ready to keep pushing.

  A fast paced story with lot of twist.
  Player-friendly
 Easy-to-learn, suitable for beginners.
  For short to medium sessions without frustrating hassles.

Investigate the area and explore detailed sceneries with a strong 50's California vibe.
Find clues and elements about a weird case by talking with NPCs, solving puzzles or interacting with the environment.
Choices matter ! On a mid-term basis your choices when talking to people could help or disadvantage you along each chapter.
Encounter new characters and win fights against them. The game is punctuated by a dozen of turn-based fights with timing system to perform critical success.
Rock Bailey, nineteen and a half, lives in Los Angeles. He promised himself he would not lose his virginity until he is 20 years old. But one night at the Zooty Slammer nightclub he is drugged, abducted and locked naked in a room with a young woman determined to make him break his vows.
Rock resists, and men then administer electric shocks to him. When he comes to his senses, he is, with all his belongings, on the side of a road. Rock decides with his friend Gary to investigate...
The story takes place in the America of the 1950s, and we draw inspiration from the most important art movement of the era.
The environments and characters are constructed with colour planes reminiscent of the colour-field painting movement, which is characterized by large canvases where colour planes dominate and surface details are rare.
Filters create a vintage feel and bring a scratched and flayed look like old posters, harking back to the aesthétics of the 50's. Retro fonts can also be used for the UI.
Finally Boris Vian criticizes the superficial side of men by inventing caricatured characters (example: the main character is as beautiful as a god), so we will orient the design of the characters in this direction.
The music is very inspired by the American 50's with Jazz, Blues and the early Rock of Elvis. The brass instruments will be the driving force behind the music of the game to bring rhythm to the battle scenes and intensity to the story.

All our physical rewards will be manufactured by local companies and in an ethical manner.
Because the subject of our game is unconventional, we want to present it to our Kickstarter community and make sure that it can connect with as many people as possible.
We are now co-produced by ARTE France, which is already supporting us in this first pre-production phase. A legitimate question you might ask yourself about this co-production is why we are looking to kickstarter for an additional source of funding. Quite simply because ARTE is a partner, not a sponsor, and its contribution does not cover all of our costs. So we continue to look for funding.
And since La Poule Noire is a worker cooperative, we are very attached to the community spirit. We would be very happy to be able to grow it and include as many people as possible in this new project. Come and help us build this new adventure!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This new game is our most ambitious yet. THWTU is a narrative game but we're adding a lot of point and click mechanics and a combat system. On top of that we decided to acquire the rights to Boris Vian's book and we want to make sure that the game is as enjoyable for those who have read it as it is for those who haven't. Finally Boris Vian's family must also be satisfied with the work done by La Poule Noire and it would be a pride for us to know that they liked the game. 

But don't panic. We know what we are doing and this project is a very motivating challenge. To begin with, the game is not that different from our first game, so all the tools we created back then are being reused. Our process being already largely validated we were able to focus on the new mechanics and thus shorten our pre-production. We all work remotely, all the money raised will be used to pay salaries, nothing else, as we already have all the hardware and licenses we need. Same for the console dev kits, we already did it, we know how to do it, it will be done no matter what! 

In contrast to the majority of game studios, we are a cooperative and this is something very important to us. Our whole business philosophy is based on mutual aid, solidarity and community. The money that each person will have the generosity to give us will be invested for the good of the project. We will be totally transparent with the backers and you will have access to our financial statements such as the total budget, the cost of salaries, etc.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! Long time no see, huh? Let's shoo the elephant out of the room and talk about the obvious question - where have we been, and how’s development going?
To make a long-ish story short, development on The Adventures of Bluke Bifton continues daily, and we’ve made tons and tons of progress! However, some aspects of development have been much, much larger undertakings than we once expected, and we’ve been paying the cost in time. Despite this, we’re really happy with the progress we’ve made, and we’re excited to share it with you.

updates.update_userinfo: Development Update #2 (Interactivity, Accessibility, and Release Windows!)
updates.update_content:
Hello again, and happy New Year! I don't know about you, but we're certainly celebrating the fact that this total skid mark of a year has finally reached its definitive end. With this new year comes new hope, and also new updates from us! So without further ado, let's get this year started off right with a quick update on what we've been up to for the past month!
To summarize the main points before digging into everything: we've added a bunch of environmental interactions with new animations, implemented every base minigame with a scoring system, created and fleshed out menus + saving/loading, added accessibility options, and added . Now, let's get into it!
Interactivity Galore!

Hello everyone - long time no see! It feels like it's been ages since we've last spoke... and simultaneously like basically no time has passed at all. Time is pretty weird, huh?
In reality though, some time has indeed passed since The Adventures of Bluke Bifton was funded, so it only feels right to release the game's first development update! In the past 1.8 months (we did the math) the two of us have been working on a manner of things: designing and building minigames, revamping the game's art style, adding emotes and effects to dialogue, crafting backer rewards, and simply polishing up the game in general, both internally and from a gameplay perspective. We'd love to show off and break down some of these new additions/changes - so we will, right here!

updates.update_userinfo: The Adventures of Bluke Bifton’s campaign is officially complete - Thank you!!

updates.update_content: Hello everyone - fantastic news! As of this moment, The Adventures of Bluke Bifton: Chapter One is 110% FUNDED!

updates.update_userinfo: 3 days left - it’s the final push!
updates.update_content: This is it: only 3 days left! This is the final push for our campaign, and though we still have a fair bit to raise, we’re confident that this project can be funded with everyone’s support! It’s been amazing to see everyone chip in to help with this crazy game of ours, and we really mean it when we say that it means a lot. These last 3 days will be the deciding factor for our campaign, so if you can help out in any way - whether it be spreading the word, directly backing the game, or anything of that sort - or have been helping out already, we really do appreciate it.

updates.update_userinfo: One week left! (+ other fun stuff)
updates.update_content: It’s our campaign’s final week! That’s right: We only have 7 more days to reach our funding goal for the game. We still have a ways to go, but we know we can make it to our goal with everyone’s support. If you know anybody who may be interested in the game, just want to spread the word in general, or anything of the sort, we’d appreciate your help immensely. This is going to be a push, but if the support the game has received so far is any indication, we can definitely do it! Let’s make it happen!

campaign.story:
Demons Ate My Neighbors! is a retro-inspired twin-stick roguelite shooter developed by Tuned-Out Games that's bringing nostalgic cult arcade horror to PC and Nintendo Switch™ in 2021! 
Wishlist Demons Ate My Neighbors on Steam!
Check out GameSpot's preview here! 

Game Title: Demons Ate My Neighbors!
Platforms: PC, Switch (See Stretch Goals for XBX and PS5!)
Players: 1-2, Co-op
Game Type: Twin-stick shooter with roguelite elements
1991 - it seems like any other sweltering July in the sleepy suburbs of Fairweather Valley... Until a cursed VHS unleashes untold horrors upon the neighborhood, turns the residents evil, and generally makes April & Joey's summer a total bummer.  
Our heroes must exorcise their neighbors from hell, fight their way back to the haunted High School and rewind their summer to save the world!  
What happens when you mix the manic, scary, funny tone of Zombies Ate My Neighbors, with rogue-lite combat of Enter the Gungeon or The Binding of Isaac with of the funky co-op chaos of ToeJam & Earl?  You get DAMN! (Demons Ate My Neighbors!)  
Join April and Joey, two brave teens from 1991 wielding holy Splasha squirt guns to fight the "Modulation" that threatens Fairweather Valley.
 Entrusted with a high-tech device called the "RadWatch", you'll never get lost finding possessed citizens in our procedurally-generated levels. Spray, pray, & find the way - with the RadWatch. 
With the radical radar radio, you can find citizens, treasure and danger, and level it up by slaying monsters to boost its range and ability to find survivors - and hurry! The road to hell is paved with good intentions.
Two Heads Are Better than Dead! Team up in local co-op, then pump, refill, and spill 'em all with the Splasha squirt guns, loaded with an infinite supply of holy water. Pump past the limit with Overpump and unleash holy hydro hell. 
Swap & Pop nozzles to drench demons with different shots, effects and overblasts - then upgrade your Splasha's stats with Nitro Splashtanks found throughout the 'burbs of Fairweather. 
Weapons that aren't your Splasha are generally household items that range from m80s to soda cans, and may be lethal. Knock over mailboxes, trashcans and more to build our your arsenal with a variety of tricks to exploit monster weaknesses. 
Freeze Zombos with your nitrogen blaster, Zap Zaplings with electrical boxes, and Vaporize Vampunks with garlic pizza. 
Need something specific? Go visit Bob's!
Depending on your choices, some citizens will be Tuned-Out! and transform to climactic combat challenges where one of the three choices must be made: DAMN, DELIVER... OR DIE. 
You're in control of how to deal with bosses - You can choose to be kind and rewind by draining their recharging stamina with a Holy Hi-Fi arsenal to DELIVER them from evil, or blast through your problems with Lethal Lo-Fi weaponry to permanently DAMN them to HELL! 
Collect VHS tokens from Boss Demons to buy VHS Tapes from the state-of-the-art VHS VENDING MACHINE with new movies to inspire (and unlock) new permanent meta upgrades in the hideout.  
No two games are the same, as the game and world are living through both your progress and we have planned, free updates for the game post-launch.   Don't worry about death - with infinite timelines, another April & Joey are ready to DAMN! or Deliver all over again. 
Traverse through Fairweather Valley's most iconic locations as you battle your way to Fairweather Valley High School - using our patented Jim Boonie Land Plot System, each visit will feel funky fresh!
Fairweather Valley Mall - Let's Go Shopping!
Join The Watch, a generations old secret organization sworn to protect the town of Fairweather Valley. 
A posh 17-year old high-school senior-to-be, this “City Girl" reluctantly relocated to the boring 'Burbs, April longs for the excitement that used to be her life. A lover of music, her current jam is the bad-ass female RnB / Hip Hop Girl Group “DLC”. 
April is a leader when push-comes-to-shove, and her outside-the-box style and way of thinking makes her the outlier in a town of seemingly little substance.   
Joey is kinda a bad boy, tbh
The cool, collected, class clown - if he shows up to class. Joey comes from the wrong side-of-the-tracks and mixes with an infamous delinquent gang of misfits & greasers. 
This sophomore-to-be can bench 300 pounds, but underneath the layers of muscle and cheeseburgers lies a heart of gold.
He wants to become a famous rapper but is too embarrassed to perform in front of the boys.
Battle the citizens and Bosses of Fairweather Valley, choosing to either let them be DAMN'd or Deliver them from evil (depending on the lethality of your weapon).  
Some of Fairweather's citizens have been particularly affected by the Modulation, and stand in the way of your journey.  
They've been violently transformed into BOSS DEMONS - and you must use everything you've got to exorcise them and clear the way to absolution. 
Sheriff Pickens (and his trusty shotgun, Volkov)
You'd better believe there's gonna be an old school 3D filter you can turn on and off!
Ms. Kayla Gill, The Teacher From The Black Lagoon
 Jams to slay monsters to are imperative - and DAMN will feature a dynamic 80's and 90's inspired soundtrack brought to you by some legendary talent.  
Music by amazing artists like Tee Lopes, Varien, Nice Legs and Papoose - and maybe even a few more surprises... 
PLAY

 * Please note the physical edition is a retro-style case and map/manual, and does not include a physical disc. We are talking to some physical publishers, and will make sure all backers of this campaign are able to get first crack and future physical console editions.
Our mission at Tuned-Out Games is to give back to the gaming community; to connect fresh new talent from diverse backgrounds and provide a platform to collaborate on game development.
We aim to bring a funky, fresh perspective to classic gaming formulas and focus on positive experiences built on bringing people together.
With game industry experience spanning titles like 2064: Read Only Memories, ToeJam & Earl: Back in the Groove!, Sonic Mania, and companies like Razer and Red Bull Gaming, Tuned-Out Games has the chops to accomplish exactly that.
We also have some amazing advisors joining us from across the gaming and entertainment industry including Greg Johnson, (Creator of ToeJam & Earl ) and voice over work from luminaries such as Adam Harrington (The Wolf Among Us) and Macaulay Culkin (Ri¢hie Ri¢h).
PLAY

Demons Ate My Neighbors! launches in Fall 2021 on Nintendo Switch and PC in English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Japanese. 
Please visit Demons Ate My Neighbors!’ official website, join the Discord, and follow the game on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitch.
DROP IN, TURN UP, TUNE OUT!!
Thank you for joining The Watch and checking out our game Demons Ate My Neighbors!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Creating a functional video game that can be released within both the budget and the time constraints we have set is always subject to influences outside of our control.

We already have a functioning vertical slice of the game and are gaining substantial publisher interest. We are working within a conservative scope and with talented industry veterans so we believe we can achieve everything we have set out to do without over committing and also allowing for minor setback.

We believe that transparency is key and it is our mission to keep everyone who has backed our game informed of everything that is going on, both good and bad. Honesty isn’t just the best policy, it is the only policy.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Closing this Kickstarter - and relaunching one SOON! Thank you!
updates.update_content:
Thanks for believing!
As we've stated in previous updates, we wanted to leave the KS open for a while so we could get some great info and not abruptly cancel on you. To reiterate - some bad timing, big news stories, new opportunities, and new learnings have led us to relaunch our campaign soon. We're currently figuring out our strategy for launching the new Kickstarter - we're hoping to get one out in October - but after that, November and December aren't great months to launch - so we may move to January!

updates.update_userinfo: A few last updates before we officially wind down THIS Kickstarter in preparation for the NEXT!
updates.update_content:
Hello Watchers!
We've received wonderful feedback from the survey we've put out from both backers, non-backers, and from other sources - and we hear and are addressing a lot of your concerns loud and clear - but moreso, let us say how PUMPED we are to read about your mutual desire to see a game like this come about - and THANK you for all of the amazing praise.

updates.update_content:
Hey Watchers!
Thanks for coming along this journey with us or just keeping an eye on the project. A few days ago, we did an update for Backers only with a survey - and now we'd like to open up the same survey (but collected in a different pool) to the public. Click below.
https://forms.gle/cAcrnEzZL4XUECxM7

updates.update_userinfo: Watchers! Here's a DAMN cool survey - we want YOUR input on how to make this the best game & Kickstarter ever
updates.update_content:
Hello Watchers!
So continuing from our last post, there's a few reasons we've kept our KS page up for a bit longer while we wind down before shutting it down completely - and that's so we can give backers warning and ask you a few questions regarding the development of our game.
So we'll address a few things here -

updates.update_userinfo: Ending the Kickstarter campaign in the next couple days, but not before we get your opinions!
updates.update_content:
DAMN! looks like we got eclipsed by a bunch of (pretty awesome) gaming news stories on the first few days of our Kickstarter, which had a big effect on our trajectory and reach - and also served to teach us a few valuable lessons as well as provide great insight.

We want to thank everyone from the bottom of our hearts for their generosity and support in making Demons Ate My Neighbors a reality - and humbly ask for a little patience as we stop THIS current Kickstarter campaign shortly to focus on some major improvements.

But FEAR NOT! The dead don't die! The attention you helped bring us has unearthed some great opportunities - we'll be back, stronger than ever - with a new goal and stronger campaign with more fleshed out backer tiers - around late September / early October - this time, for all major systems, not just Switch & PC - but for PSN, XBOX, PC & Switch!!! And with better physical rewards for those of you who love to kick-it old school.

We've got a few other surprises and exciting things to share as well, so STAY TUNED!
We appreciate you all, and by the metrics of most Kickstarters, this was a smashing success with over $40,000 raised in just 3 days - so we would be honored if you continued your support for what will be an even more exciting product when we launch our NEW Kickstarter soon.
Follow @ on Twitter for the latest updates.

After all, games, especially roguelites - are about falling and starting over again, with more skill and knowledge than you had before. Totally on-brand.

We shall rise again in a few short weeks time, enough to make for a spooktacular October... until then, loyal Watchers - Drop in, Turn Up and TUNE OUT!!
We hope to see you soon!

Stay pumped.

- Kian Matthew Naderi
(Director, Demons Ate My Neighbors)

updates.update_userinfo: Demons Ate My Neighbors will rise again! 🙏 A NEW Kickstarter appears?
updates.update_content:
Today’s topic is the OverPump mechanic on your Splasha and your pressure gauge.
As we mentioned yesterday, when you spray water from your Splasha, your water pressure goes down. While it does recover automatically, its a slow process, and pumping with Left Trigger helps you get back to full splashing sooner than later.
When your Splasha gets too full, as in, you pump beyond the pressure capacity, you can load an OverPump Blast. This is a valuable tool for getting past big crowds, and most types of OverPump have either a wide range of attack, a powerful direct attack, or a big pushback effect.

campaign.story:
Facebook  | Twitter  | YouTube | Official Website | Steam 
Steam  https://store.steampowered.com/app/1351140/KAPIA/
KAPIA is a 3D story-driven adventure unfolding in a funky apocalyptic universe.
If you want to give extra support for the development after the Kickstarter campaign, you can do it through PayPal donation.  PayPal donation 
paypal.me/2for2team
The World Union has collapsed, the nations are divided into coalitions "East" and "West," a mysterious intelligent infection is forcing people to live under city lockdown. This is the world that needs saving–the world of KAPIA.
Amidst the chaos, Stefan, a retired pilot and a strong-willed grandfather, takes on the responsibility of ending the conflict. Little does he know his most powerful ally will be his little granddaughter, Reny.
Release
2021 Q2 on Steam and GOG.
Controller or Point-and-click
A traditional point-and-click flow with an easily accessible drop-down inventory. To make things more exciting, we added a first-person close-up menu where you can interact with various items.
or
Play KAPIA with your controller and enjoy a modern game flow from your couch.  

Play for both characters
People have different sides to them; the same goes for characters in KAPIA. Discover the story from different perspectives as you play for both Stefan and Reny. Follow their own unique paths to achieve a common goal.
Unique 3D design
Enjoy a carefully crafted environment that suits the unusual combination of medieval architecture and futuristic gadgets. Intelligent robots walk the streets of stone pavement, power banks light up antique lamps, while typewriters serve as input devices for powerful computers.
Puzzles and mini-games
Just like in traditional point-and-click most puzzles are tied up with objects, but there are also conversational puzzles and a whole bunch of logical mini-games. 
Voiced dialogues
We selected voice talents from all over the world based on their acting skills, and they didn’t disappoint. Each actor brought to the game a part of their own experience making the world of KAPIA truly multinational.
 The long-run of the game will take approximately 5 hours. However, if you decide to dive into the world of KAPIA and explore our story-driven adventure more deeply, the game will take you much longer. If you want to know exactly how this estimate works, try playing the demo version. It should take around 90 minutes.
The entire game was built around contrasts. Stefan and Reny are very different, but they are also a family. As you play the game, you will learn about aspects of their identities that make this pair representative of the world that Stefan and Reny are on the quest to heal.
Each level is designed for either Stefan or Reny.
 Gameplay example for each character:  
 Levels that feature Stefan is where you learn the background story. Puzzles are more dialogue-oriented and the gameplay experience is tilted towards thoughtful and mysterious awareness.
   Reny’s levels are designed to have less narrative and more mechanics-oriented puzzles. Reny will be your window into private relationships between the characters as they open up in their attitude towards a small girl.
KAPIA is a story-driven point-and-click adventure executed in the classical style of 3D quests from the mid-2000s.
Our two-person development team are big fans of games of the “golden age” in point-and-click, such as Full Throttle, Grim Fandango, The Longest Journey, Still Life, and Syberia. These games shaped our taste for game development and for point-and-click as a whole.
Five years ago, in Latvia, the idea for our point-and-click adventure KAPIA took its final form. Self-funded and produced by our family, our game encompasses a wide range of people and their ideas from different parts of the world. 
2for2 is a husband and wife team.
We’ve been together for 17 years, 15 as a married couple and business partners. From the very start of our common journey, we decided to spend as much time together as possible, and we stuck to that promise.
As a freelance team, our career revolves around special effects for movie production, programming for 3D engines, architectural visualization, game asset development, educational simulation, and many more game development related jobs.
Our job and lifestyle make us very mobile. For the last 10 years we’ve traveled the world, staying in a different country for 2-4 years at a time. It hasn’t always been easy, but we value the experience of diving into different cultures.
All you need is a mouse to explore the world of KAPIA. Click to walk, click to talk, click to interact. It is that simple.
Right-click → Your interaction with objects and characters.
Left-click → Cancels the action.
Middle-click → Brings up the close-up of the inventory.
There is an autosave feature, so you don’t need to worry about losing your progress.
Controller support is available! Play KAPIA from your couch. 
Four years in development
KAPIA is our first game, and we had to learn a lot before we could build our own, unique pipeline. We wrote scripts to minimize the manual work, arranged data transfer, tried different engines, and backed a Kickstarter for PERCEPTION NEURON motion capture.
The result of this overall investment shows in the fully animated dialogues throughout the game, thought out story, and uniform quality of the entire project. Basically, we did a lot of preparation work before we even started making the game.
Animation
There is a lot of animation work in KAPIA. We animated every dialogue, every interaction with objects, and of course the world itself.
While we handcrafted the first-person animations that you see throughout the game, using motion capture was a huge collaboration when it came to dialogues.
Why Kickstarter?
With some heavy budgeting, we managed to self-fund the development from the beginning. Right now, we are asking you to help us support the final portion.
15% of the core budget will go to a composer that we want to bring to the project. Custom music is important, and we want to provide this experience to the players.
22% of the budget will cover the remaining voice-overs. We funded the current ones in the demo, but with 30000 words, voiced dialogues for KAPIA don't come cheap.
The development itself will take around 40% of the budget. Both of us need to be full time on the project to have it finished by 2021 Q2.
The rest will cover taxes and Kickstarter fees, which add up to 23% of the budget.
If we can go beyond the initial goal, there is an array of very important stretch goals that will become available as we progress.
IMMEDIATELY UPON RELEASE:
Kickstarter specials
 KAPIA Box Version 

T-shirt 
 Digital Artbook 
Our Digital Artbook is an opportunity to get behind the scenes of making the KAPIA game. Every asset in our world was crafted specifically for KAPIA.
Over the past two years, we’ve been making short videos about asset creation. Our artbook will feature selected videos that were collected, sorted, and completed with explanations.
PLAY

 Your drawing on the loading screen 
KAPIA is inviting artists to become a part of our game development team. We'll ask you, or your young artist if you have a child in mind, to create a drawing on the proposed topic. For example, "Grandpa is skiing." After we receive the drawing, we'll redraw it to fit the storyline. Your initial art along with an altered picture will become a loading screen.
You will receive a video of the loading screen to show your friends and family. The first name of the artist will appear on the special part of the credits section.
As an additional reward, you will receive a custom digital artist diploma.
 Customize an NPC Robot 
There are just a few NPC robots in the game, and you get to customize one of them.
There is a choice of a hat, a hairstyle, or a scarf that you can design for a robot. You can make your own sketch or take a picture of something you already have or like. We will transfer your idea into a 3D model and will include your NPC into a final copy of our game.
In addition, you get to name your NPC Robot. Some naming restrictions may apply, so please be reasonable.

 Name an NPC Robot 
Please be reasonable! Come up with a name of your own. Don’t make it too long or something inappropriate. No one enjoys negativity in adventure quests.

 Your eye color in the game 
You will send us a picture of your eye or will choose your own color, we will stylize it and feature it in the game as one of the spying eye models scattered around various levels. This will make you a part of the story and the onlooker.

 Breathing voice over 
Breath heavily into a microphone and send us the file, this sound will become a voice-over for one of the NPC characters. Your name will be added to credits in a voice-over section.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I can safely say that we will definitely finish the game. I can be this certain because we’ve never dropped a project before and I see no reason for us to start doing it now. 
Having said that, there could be slight delays due to the unpredictable nonsense of 2020.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Enjoy a carefully crafted environment that suits the unusual combination of medieval architecture and futuristic gadgets. Unique never goes out of style.
Reusability and recyclability

First one uses a flash drive, which is very much reusable. 
Second one is a t-shirt. Wear it, make a rug out of it, get creative, get recycling.

campaign.story:
Fallen City Brawl is a hard-hitting 2D pixel-art beat 'em up with a strong late 80's/early 90's retro arcade influence.   Fallen City Brawl is in development for Steam (PC/Mac), PS4, Switch and Xbox One.   
Huge pixel-art sprites and animated backgrounds across 8 stages of hand-to-hand  brawling!
Deep fighting system - combos, counters, parries, air-throws, grappling, special moves, RIOT ('Super') moves.  Smash the enemies through destructible scenery and continue the fight with some ground n pound!
Powerful soundtrack composed by Daniel Lindholm (Street Fighter V, Yakuza: Dead Souls)
Four playable characters each with their own combos, special moves, RIOT moves and story told through animated cut-scenes!
Large range of weapons to be picked up including bats, pipes, knives, oil drums, hand guns, assault rifle, shot-gun, crates, grenades, chains and chainsaws!
Two-player local co-op! Brawl together, with special 'tag-team' moves. 
Mercenary back-up: upgrade-able, heavily armed mercenary attacks clear the screen of enemies with devastating force!
A ferocious wolf fights alongside you through some sections of the game - command him to loyally defend you, or unleash him, sit back and watch the carnage!
A brutal battle for control of Fallen City's criminal underworld rages, shaping the fate of four strangers, each skilled in devastating hand-to-hand combat.  They fight together in a brawl across the city to a final showdown that will decide who lives and who falls.  
A story of  ambition and revenge,  forced to team up to survive and joined by a ferocious wolf, their motivations and pasts will collide testing their loyalty as well as their fighting skills.  Only the best of the best will survive Fallen City Brawl!
The soundtrack is a vital element of a great beat 'em up.  I'm thrilled that Fallen City Brawl's  soundtrack is being composed by Daniel Lindholm, whose  triple-A credits include Street Fighter V (Ed, Menat, Zeku, Sakura, SFVA2, Cody, G, E. Honda, Lucia), and Yakuza: Dead Souls 
Daniel is  creating something exceptional for Fallen City Brawl. You can hear Daniel's work on the game in the trailer introducing this campaign, plus more below - a work in progress track for a stage of the game currently in development.  Daniel walks through the creative process here, along with clips from the track.  
The soundtrack will feature Japanese City-pop, Detroit techno, big beat, funk electronica and fusion, with influences from 80's and 90's action cinema scores including those by Jerry Goldmith (Rambo First Blood Part II, Total Recall) Harold Faltermeyer (Beverly Hills Cop 1&2, Topgun),and Basil Poledouris (Robocop).  A digital version of the soundtrack is available as a Reward!
Four playable characters can be selected from the start.  Each has a range of basic, special and RIOT ('Super')moves.  A ferocious wolf joins the fight during some parts of the game!  
'Iron' Jackson 
Former gang leader, fighting to regain the power he once had.  A Street fighter, Jackson crushes opponents with a heavy chain.

 Ricco  
A Self-taught, undefeated kickboxer, fighting to exact revenge through grief-fuelled rage!
Sgt. Clay 
 A SWAT team cop in too deep with the gangs of Fallen City.  A former Mixed Martial Arts champion.
Natasha 
Ambitious, reckless, Natasha is skilled in combat helicopter and heavy weapon repair. Armed with a wrench and brutal Tae-Kwondo skills!
Wolf
Loyal and ferocious, the wolf fights alongside you through some of your journey.  Name him in-game and command him to attack or defend!
Wolf take-down!

There will be eight stages in Fallen City Brawl, each with hidden areas, often revealed by smashing through destructible scenery.  Two stages are currently playable in game, the rest are in different stages development at the moment, will be sharing more with backers soon!
Stage 1: City Streets 
Take the fight to the city streets and then under the bridge as animated traffic streams overhead, headlights illuminating the brawl below! 
Stage 2: Sunrise Gym  
Train hard, fight easy! Battle through a boxing gym, gloves off.  Punchbags swing and pillars and walls smash with the impact of the fight!
Destructible scenary in Sunrise Gym
Stage 3: Stock Car Race Track  
Burning rubber and exhaust fumes fill the air in a fight though the stadium, down to the pits and across the racetrack whilst stock cars scream past! 
This stage will be set against a setting sun, changing the way the stage is lit as the fight continues. 
Stage 4: Storm Beach  A storm rages and has closed-out the beach.  With cliffs on all sides, huge waves crash down as the fight continues through the surf.
I'll share more details on stages 5 to 8 as the game continues through its development!

The fighting system in Fallen City Brawl is fast, hard-hitting and with real depth and scope, featuring combos, counters, parries, throws (including some air-throws), ground n pound, grappling, special moves, and RIOT ('Super') moves - these are available as the blue flaming bar at the bottom of the screen fills up.  Higher combos and counters fill it faster than regular attacks.  Here's a work-in-progress example:
A key feature is destructible scenery - walls, pillars and doors will crumble and shatter when enemies are thrown into them, causing extra damage and opening up new areas to fight through.  
The fight  doesn't stop when enemies are knocked down - all characters can use ground and pound to continue the fight, some can grapple on the floor too.  
Lots of weapons can be picked up and used to help even up the fight- bats, pipes, knives, oil drums, hand guns, assault rifle, shot-gun, crates, grenades, chains and chainsaws! 
Special Forces back-up: upgrade-able, heavily armed mercenary attacks clear the screen of enemies with devastating force!  As you fight through the game you can build the level of support you'll receive from the mercenaries, balancing whether to unleash it, or to keep building it to then unleash heavier and more powerful attacks later.  You can see in the trailer mercenaries power-sliding their car into the screen and causing carnage.  Higher levels include a full-on attack from a Hind Mil Mi-24 attack helicopter! 
Battle Mode!
Battle Mode sets players against each other one-on-one! Play in competitive  two player mode, or fight one player against an increasingly tough series of enemy encounters.  The clip below is quite early work-in-progress, but I'm looking into the possibility of being able to play as ANY character from the game in this mode (including enemies and bosses too!).  
Fallen City Brawl is in development for Steam (PC/Mac), PS4, Switch and Xbox One. Backers will receive a survey after the completion of the campaign to indicate choice of platform.  
I've self-funded Fallen City Brawl's development so far, investing my own money and time over nearly a three year period.  This has been enough to get the project to where it is today.  However, I aim for Fallen City Brawl to stand toe-to-toe with the best beat 'em ups in the genre.  There's still lots of work to do, and to achieve that standard and be able to release the game in the near future, I really need your help!
I'm lucky that Fallen City Brawl has a community of passionate supporters.  I hope the Kickstarter campaign will help many more people to hear about the game's development and join our community.  Getting feedback on the project's development has been so important to reach the stage we're at and I'm looking forward to continuing to shape the game with Fallen City Brawl's backers!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fallen City Brawl's development is progressing well and many key building blocks on the road to competing the game are well-advanced. Two stages of the game are playable using each of the four characters. The core of the combat system - combos, counters, collision detection, running, special moves etc are in place, for some characters a little more developed than others. Music is in development and sounding great. 

Getting these foundations in place were some of the challenges that I wanted to overcome before launching the Kickstarter campaign - having these well advanced means I can be confident that development should now take around 10 months. 

I'm realistic on setting expectations, conscious of avoiding 'feature creep' and 100% committed to creating an outstanding beat 'em up. I strongly value regular dialogue with people interested in the game's development and understand the importance of communicating progress. I've kept this principle over past couple of years through regular Twitter and newsletter updates and will continue to work closely with the fantastic community which has built up around Fallen City Brawl - through to the release and afterwards!

campaign.story:
Hello everyone, and on behalf of the team, welcome to the official Kickstarter for The Rhino and the Redbill, an action-adventure animated pilot that we need your help to make a reality!
My name is Alex Henderson, and for years now I have been developing animated content for film, television, video games, and more. Now with your help, I'm looking to branch out into creating more original content. My team and I specialise in blending 2D and 3D animation to create unique art styles that are both efficient and appealing, and we're ready to take these styles into this next big project. The Rhino and the Redbill is a story we've been developing for several years now and have been looking to bring to life through animation. We're seeking funding to create an 11 minute animated action-adventure pilot episode that we can take to festival screenings and industry events, and eventually release publicly for everyone to enjoy. This would ultimately serve as a proof of concept for producing more content. 
The short is meant to appeal to all ages, dealing with mature themes that adults can appreciate while still being accessible to younger audiences. The tone is meant to fall in the same vein as shows like Samurai Jack and Avatar: The Last Airbender. 
In the wild, Rhinos and Red-Billed Oxpeckers have a very unique symbiotic relationship. The oxpeckers spend their day nestled on top of the rhino for food and protection, and in return they help to alert the often visually-impaired rhinos if there is danger in the area. They can however, be a nuisance to their hosts, often picking at wounds when searching for food, and their bond can quickly turn parasitic. 
Based on their relationship in the wild, The Rhino and the Redbill is an action-adventure short about a blind rhinoceros named Niles, and a flight-impaired oxpecker named Redford, working together to survive the harsh realities of a drought ravaged wilderness. Scorchwater Valley is dying and it's taking everyone else down with it. It's every creature for themselves as social structures have collapsed and factions of carnivorous gangs, evil cults, and deadly poachers struggle to survive. Niles and Redford have to work together to survive in a dying world, provided they can survive each other.
Concept art of Redford and Niles
Niles is a gruff and surly mercenary. He talks a big talk, walks a big walk, and can take down pretty much anyone who challenges him on it. Even though he is legally blind, he doesn't let that stop him from being a force to be reckoned with. The work is still dangerous though, and finding a safe place to call home in the valley is no small task, so Niles reluctantly accepts help from Redford, his trusty guide bird to help him through the treacherous badlands.
Redford is an upbeat bird who acts as a lookout and navigator for his larger-than-life friend. Red owes a lot of his friendly attitude to how oblivious he is of the dangers around. While he tries to be approachable, he's a bit naive to how irritating he can be, especially to a grouch like Niles. While they clash a lot, Niles and Red remain reluctant friends, and they're stronger together than they are apart.
The Rhino and the Redbill is a project that makes use of 2D and 3D animation techniques, to craft a visual style consistent with TV animation standards that is also cost effective to produce. The process involves using 3D models, hand drawn render passes, matte paintings, and more, to create a visual style meant to emulate works such as Samurai Jack and Spiderman: Into the Spiderverse. 
In the trailer you can see plenty of examples of finished animation to give you an idea of the graphic style that we are striving for. 
Compared to most animated pilots, The Rhino and the Redbill is a relatively inexpensive project. Thanks to the streamlined rendering and rigging processes developed whilst making Breathing Space, we are animating at a fast rate without sacrificing quality.
To get this project off the ground, we are starting with a goal of $24,000 CA to develop the 11 minute animated pilot. This money will mostly go towards funding the animation, as that makes up the bulk of what needs to be done. We've already done several scenes to get a sense of how much time it will take to complete the project, and this number will cover the cost of labour for our estimated time frame.
We are also offering plenty of stretch goals to help expand the project should we hit our funding goal! Hitting these milestones will allow us to expand our festival run, and add new content such as bonus scenes and opening theme sequences!
At the moment we have already done a sizeable chunk of production work, which has allowed us to keep the remainder of the project at a lower cost. So far The Rhino and the Redbill has finished pre-production, with a full story reel completed, and plenty of shots already put into production. The work has been going very smoothly, and with your help, we are excited to take it to the next level.
In addition to completing the film, we are also offering some fun rewards to our backers. There are digital bundles that include getting your name in the credits, the downloadable soundtrack, and the digital art book.
Sample Mock Ups of the Art Book
If you're looking for physical rewards, we are also offering various acrylic charms and a poster, which all feature artwork of the film's characters.
Sample Mock Ups of the Acrylic Charms (Comes with a Key Chain Ring)
At some of our higher backer reward levels, we are offering the opportunity to be involved in the project in more unique ways. This can include getting a producer credit, which gives you plenty of industry cred for sponsoring an independent project, and also gets your name or the name of your company in the opening credits. You can also pledge to have a character of your own design make an appearance in the pilot! (See FAQ for more details).
We've had plenty of great and talented people helping to develop this project to what it is today, many of whom have work that can be seen in the trailer. A big thanks to our two leads  Foster "Adler" Eber and  Richie Ammons, playing Red and Niles respectively. Both have years of experience with voice acting and have delivered great performances. This project wouldn't have been possible without them. Follow the links to their websites to see more samples of their great work.
Also in our talented cast is Rob Schwarb, who has been contributing additional voices to the project. He's got a wide arsenal of unique voices that have gone a long way to bringing our animations to life. Follow the link to check out more of his work.
We would also like to thank Joshua David Mitchell for the music he has been providing for the project. We've had some great people helping out with this project, with plenty more we'll be adding along the way. 
If you want to follow along with the project, be sure to check out the director's Twitter, where we regularly post updates and in progress work from the project.
Thanks for taking the time to check us out. We’re very excited to keep moving forward with this project, and we hope we can count on your support!
Key art from our previous film "Breathing Space"
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Animation isn't easy, I won't lie. There's a lot of work involved and a lot to coordinate. Fortunately, this isn't my first time doing it. This will be the fourth animated short that I have produced, the most recent film “Breathing Space”, was made on a similar budget and time frame. And because this entire project is digital media and we already have access to the necessary tools and software, the only costs needed to be covered are for labour and merchandise. With our team of experienced professionals, I am confident that we will not only repeat success, but take our work to the next level.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,

We've reached the end of our Kickstarter journey! Thanks again to everyone for all their support along the way. This will be our last update as I've just released the final film as well as all digital rewards to everyone who backed the project and was set to receive the digital rewards bundles.  If you were a backer at one of these levels then you should have received an email earlier today with links to everything. If you haven't or have run into any errors, just shoot me a message here or at AlexHendersonAnimation@gmail.com and I will do what I can to get it resolved.

Hi everyone,

We're in the final lap of production, so this will be our last update for the pilot film.  All animation has been completed, and we're just doing final sound editing and colour corrections before the final release. We'll be emailing out links to the films premiere for backers as well as all other digital rewards on March 29th.

Hey everybody,

Welcome to the new year! I'm here again with our usual monthly update. A little late into the month, but that's only because we've been hard at work. Normally I would break down the milestones we've hit to give you all an idea of the progress we've made, but as we enter the final stretches I'm going to be ditching that format and just letting you know where we are in the production. Right now we're just finishing up with compositing the last of the shots, less than 20% left, which means that we are close to having a final cut ready. I predict that I should have all the clips in premiere by the end of the month. So what does that mean for getting the final pilot film and the digital rewards to you all?...

Hey everyone,

Just dropping in for the monthly update on the film. We've made a lot of good progress this month. Character animation has been mostly wrapped up, with the exception of a few shots that need some revisions. About 1/3 of the film has been pushed into compositing, and seeing it all come together as finished pieces has been very exciting. People have also started receiving some physical rewards in the mail! It's all coming together and it's all very exciting!

Hello everyone,

Just stopping in for our monthly progress update to keep all of our backers informed. Progress on the film is going well, and we are still on track to hit all of our deadlines. This month we've produced a few more minutes of animation and plenty of background paintings. We've also started rendering and doing final compositing a good number of shots and I have to say it's really cool seeing it all start to come together.  Physical rewards have begun shipping out gradually. You should receive an email when your charms have been shipped, and the last of the posters are coming in and will be shipping out soon.

Hey everyone,

Since it's the beginning of the month I wanted to stop in and give a bit of a progress update to let you all know where the film is as well as the state of the physical rewards. All in all the film is going great, everything is being completed at a rate that was expected and we are on track to hit all of our deadlines.

Hey everyone,
Time for a mid-month mini update, as we're prepping to get our physical rewards ready for shipping. We've been working with Pawprint Press to get the charms and posters made, and we've gotten some great samples! We're looking to start shipping out the physical rewards in October, but before we do we wanted to put out a reminder that if you haven't filled out your backer survey please do so, as we need a shipping address to send you your physical rewards.

Hey everyone, 
It's the first of the month, and like I promised, I'm here to give everyone an update showing where we are in the production. In short, everything is going well and we are on track to hit our estimated delivery date. Animation is going smoothly and the renders are looking good when composited with the matte paintings. We've begun working with a merchandising company to help with the distribution of physical rewards and will be getting those out as soon as we've refined the test proofs.

Hello Everyone,
Now that kickstarter's payment processing is nearing completion, I've sent out the surveys for the backer rewards. These are just to collect some basic information, such as shipping addresses, what email address you'd like to receive the digital rewards (in case it's different from the one used in your kickstarter account), and how you'd like to be presented in the credits. If you could fill it out at your earliest convenience I would greatly appreciate it.

The Project is Funded!
Hey everyone,
Wow! We did it… and then some! After 30 days, 392 backers, and $28,700 CAD, we have a successful kickstarter under our belt. But the journey is just beginning. First off, I want to express my eternal gratitude to everyone who supported this project along the way. Be it through financially backing it, sharing it with others, or even providing words of encouragement, I couldn’t have done this without you. Animation has been a long time passion of mine and seeing people come out to support independently produced projects like this one just fills me with joy, and I owe it to all of you to produce the best project that I can.

What would you do to be free?
Curse of the Sea Rats is an epic hand-drawn ratoidvania starring a group of heroes transformed into rats by a pirate witch.
Help Douglas, Buffalo, Akane, and Bussa to rescue the Admiral’s son, capture the evil pirate Flora Burn and break the magic spell.
Curse of the Sea Rats packs all of the best features from the Metroidvania genre featuring beautiful 2D hand-drawn animation and 3D environments, combined with unique real-time combat mechanics, and of course, lots of rats!.
Explore the island, battle diabolic creatures, and fight brutal bosses commanded by the evil pirate Flora Burn. Forge your own path to freedom in a non-linear quest through the vast and mysterious coast of Ireland in 1777.
BEAUTIFUL ART & ANIMATION
 Classic hand-drawn animation like the golden era of Disney and Don Bluth.
   A perfect mix of 2D models crafted on a 3D game environment for a 2.5D side-scrolling platformer experience.
  Ambiance lights and shadows will affect both 2D and 3D elements and will trick your eye into believing in magic.
ACTION-PLATFORMER METROIDVANIA
 Explore a huge map with hundreds of rooms, in a non-linear quest, solving puzzles, and fighting enemies.
   4 playable characters, jam-packed with weapons and special abilities to upgrade.
  Discover all the secret rooms, special items, and multiple endings. 
ENDLESS ADVENTURE
 Single-player mode: more than 12 hours of gameplay for the main quest.
   Local Co-Op Multiplayer mode: up to 4 players.
Time is running out! Curse of the Sea Rats rewards exploration, mixing a satisfying platform experience with intense action combat. You must overcome traps and puzzles to chase Flora, rescue the Admiral's son, and break the magic spell. There is hard work ahead!
Master new skills and develop your heroes: Every playable character has a dual skill set tree. Choose the right skills from your profession or your element paths. Unlock special abilities as you progress through the story.
Take care of your inventory: It's a long and hard mission. You should find, buy, or craft special items if you want to succeed. Robert's Store is the right place to find anything you may need, always with a special discount. (Wink, wink!).
Explore a non-linear world: Explore all the areas, master every square centimeter, and discover every secret room and backtracking path in an interconnected map. Unlock ancient teleportals to move faster across the island. 
Choose your hero: 4 playable characters to play solo or local co-op. Choose between David Douglas, Buffalo Calf, Bussa, and Akane Yamakawa, each of whom has their own fighting styles.
Spectacular intros and animations: Discover the story behind the characters through dialogues and cutscenes. Sometimes past and future haunt you at the same time. Find your way but find it fast, or you will lose any chance to recover your human shape. 
We will release the game on Steam, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One. 
We are super excited about the new generation consoles coming next year. It would be great to see the game running on those awesome consoles in the future. 
LANGUAGES
The game will be localized in English, Spanish, German, French, Italian, and Catalan on the release date. After hitting our first stretch goals, we added Japanese and Russian localizations. Curse of the Sea Rats will be localized in Simplified Chinese and Czech too. Thank you very much for your support! If you want Curse of the Sea Rats in additional languages, leave us a comment in our Discord channel and we'll do our best to make it happen.
The year 1777, Army Flagship HMS Barfleur sails back from the Caribbean Islands to Great Britain full of evil pirates and prisoners like you, brought to King George to be judged.
Capt. Flora Burn, a fierce pirate-witch, creates a spell using an ancient magical talisman that turns everyone on board into rats.
The ship crashes and strands in an unknown location on the Irish coast.
Burn kidnaps the Admiral’s son and escapes from the ship with her pirate's crew running away and transforming nature into evil creatures.
The Admiral offers the remaining prisoners to recover their freedom if they rescue his son.
You must explore the island and fight frenzied waves of demonic monsters to rescue the Admiral’s son, capture Flora Burn and break the magic spell. Do you dare? 
FOUR UNIQUE PLAYABLE HEROES
Curse of the Sea Rats features four amazing playable characters, each with their own strong personalities, backstory and goals, fighting styles, and special skills. 
Forge your destiny and become the protagonist of cantina songs, or be forgotten forever. 
ENEMIES & EVIL CREATURES
Here you will see some of the horrific and inhuman adversaries our artists created. Scarier and larger bosses and creatures will follow soon!
WU YUN, GUARDIAN OF THE TALISMAN
Flora used an ancient talisman and a ring to cast the spell and transform everyone into rats. She kept the ring but lost the talisman when she ran away. Now the two arcane relics are separated.
The ancient talisman has a secret inside, somehow linked to it there is a magical presence called Wu Yun, the guardian of the talisman. Help him recover his power and he will help you recover your human shape. Capture magical energy as you destroy Flora's creatures and Wu Yun will be powerful again.
Curse of the Sea Rats is an adventure full of unique and magical places. The game includes more than 12 locations to explore set on the wild and beautiful coast of Ireland.
Every single area is designed to create a special ambiance. We put a lot of care on color key transitions and layout design to deliver a rich experience during your journey.
All across the coast are wild and magical places scattered about where you can find treasures, new items, and evil and mythical creatures to fight. 
The whole map will be constructed and polished from a huge 3D element sets and each room of the game will be designed with detailed assets.
We want to give you the most beautiful and pirate-like game possible. This is just a sample of our work, with character designs, concepts, illustrations, and background pictures that you will see in the final product.
We start designing 2D concepts of all the characters and places. The artists work together to create 3D models for the locations and props. For the characters, the animators create a special set of 2D animations for each playable and non-playable character insufflating life and personality to all of them.
The world itself starts to come alive adding all the creatures, special effects, and details tirelessly crafted by our team of amazing artists and developers.
HAND DRAWN ANIMATION
Each animation in Curse of the Sea Rats is completely hand-drawn frame by frame from scratch, and animated at 24 frames per second, to capture the full fluid quality of traditional animation, at its best.
REFERENCES
Curse of the Sea Rats is inspired by great Metroidvania games like Bloodstained, Guacamelee, and Hollow Knight. We have also been influenced by games we love to play such as Diablo, Indivisible RPG, Path of Exile, and the Street Fighter saga to name a few. 
We love games as much as we love animation. Curse of the Sea Rats pays homage to the pioneers. It represents the intersection between video games and animation, from the foundational art of Don Bluth in Dragon's Lair to the perfect mix between art and gameplay in Aladdin's Classic by Disney.
Our dream is to create a beautiful game with a lot of fun, pirates, adventures, and magic. With your help and support, we are sure that we can accomplish this mission together.
Original Score: A complete score featuring more than a dozen tracks composed just for this game by talented composer and musician Max Ballet.
In Curse of the Sea Rats, the music includes instruments from all over the world, mixing all kinds of inspirations. From the classic orchestral compositions, written for an adventure full of pirates and magic, to original music portraits written for the heroes and final bosses, while blending Old Irish and Celtic folklore.
The soundtrack is dynamically adjusted to transition seamlessly through indoor and outdoor areas, weather variations, and above all, battles and final bosses.
As a sound designer, Christophe Davaille, helped to create an amazing atmosphere, bringing life to the world and creatures in Curse of the Sea Rats.

After hitting the 200.000€ we unlocked "The Eternal Curse" - New Game Plus mode. You are amazing! Day by day, all the stretch goals of this unforgettable campaign were achieved. We are pirates and we don't follow the rules. We follow our hearts. For this reason, The Sea Rats Crew decides to unlock the last stretch goal and we will include "The Pirate's Revenge" - Hardcore Solo mode in the game as a tribute to all of you. Again, thank you from the depths of our hearts!
Curse of the Sea Rats will count on a special Survival Mode, "The Ghost Ship". Play as long as possible and fend off waves of enemies with an increasing difficulty level!  
Simplified Chinese and idle animations are unlocked too. Our 4 heroes will be more alive with the addition of extra custom animations to infuse their mood and personality traits.

Petoons Studio has been making video games since 2016. In 2018, we successfully launched Petoons Party and we won the "Best Kids Game - PlayStation Award". Later on, we launched the game for Steam, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch. We are working on Curse of the Sea Rats and developing video games for top brands around the world.
Please, visit our website www.petoons.com to learn more about Petoons Studio.
THE TEAM
Curse of the Sea Rats is a collective piece of art and more people collaborated with us to make this dream come true. Thank you all! 
We want to share our new game with you before anyone else. Kickstarter will help us to get more funding to finish the game, especially to cover the costs related to the animation. We need more artists to hand-drawn the characters and animations. Your donations will help us to complete the project without compromising the art and quality of the game. 
The project has been in development for seven months. We can finish the game on our own, but we want to involve you in the process. Here‘s how we intend to spend your donations:
With your help, we can make the best possible version of Curse of the Sea Rats. It takes a village!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Petoons Studio is a small indie game studio. Even though we learned a lot from the development and launch of Petoons Party, our first game for all the platforms, keep in mind we’re still learning. Curse of the Sea Rats is our second game, and we will launch it, with or without Kickstarter.

Curse of the Sea Rats is already perfectly playable in consoles. Our current demo is very solid and we are adding more content on a daily basis: locations, bosses, creatures, etc. 

As in every project, setbacks may occur and we will work hard to prevent and avoid delays or minimize them as much as possible. We don't expect delays with the production of the rewards and physical goods. So far, we are on track and very proud of the goals accomplished!

We want to add some extras to the game, and we can only do that with this Kickstarter and its stretch goals. We are 110% committed to the project and enjoying the development as much as we hope you enjoy the game once it is in your hands. 

Thank you very much for you support! 

Petoons Team

campaign.story:
I'm Charles Brubaker, creator of THE FUZZY PRINCESS. Last year I was able to publish the first volume of FUZZY comics with your generous help, and today I'm hoping to make the second volume a reality!
The Fuzzy Princess centers on Katrina, the adventurous feline princess of St. Paws, watched over by Chiro (a batty bat) and Kuma (whose love for haiku is only matched by his love of eating). Now they’ve been stranded in our world! Can Kat’s new human friend Jackson help them survive? Will Jackson be able to survive his new friends?
 Continuing off from where the first book left off, join Princess Kat on a voyage of self-discovery in this sec, as she explores her new talents such as:
Urban exploration!
Crimefighting!
Attempting to make Christmas dinner!
Surviving a surprise visit!
Babysitting!
Witches!
And enduring Kuma’s slam poetry!
It’s all here, and so much more.
The book contains bonus goodies such as brand new title page for each chapter, as well as an introduction and illustration by Dana Simpson of "Phoebe and Her Unicorn"!
192-PAGE PAPERBACK BOOK
PRINTED IN FULL COLOR
DIMENSIONS: 6x9"
I'm offering a variety of rewards: the book itself, original art, stickers, prints, and more!
If you missed the campaign for the first book volume but you're interested in getting it, there are tiers where you can get BOTH volumes bundled together!
NEW (2-14): You can now get TWO sheets of stickers, and FIVE buttons! They will be automatically added to all reward tiers ($40 and up) that already come with stickers and buttons.

campaign.story:
Are you ready to fight crime around the world?
  Join Crackinho in this sarcastic Beat’ em Up against crime throughout big cities at specific time eras all around the world!
Crackinho is inspired by classic 90's Beat 'em up games like Streets of Rage, Final Fight, Battletoads, River City Ransom, among others.
Although inspired by theses games, ours is a fresh and modern take on this Genre. Crackinho  Beat' em Up is quite different, because besides the classic brawling, it  adds a lot of special attacks and variations for the same strike.
The scenario was 100% made by us, the concepts, 3D models and textures. The traditional 2D animations, inspired by Cuphead, gives it a pinch of charm to the game.
We're also planning to launch the multiplayer version and online co-op.
As you explore the game, you'll unlock new features for customize the character
  such as hats, clothes, toys, visual aspects and special attacks.
  The more you go further the funnier it will become! 

 Features:
  Crackinho Beat' em Up in the World is a comical and fresh take on the Retro Fighting Games of the Old Arcades. You can join Crackinho and his Friends on this Adventure with the following Features:
Fight Crime and its Lackeys throughout Cities like São Paulo, Tokyo, Rome, Cairo, London, among others, all in different Time Periods and Parallel Realities!
  Beat'em up over 5 different Enemies per Level, each with their own Skills, Tactics and Designs, based on the City and Era they are terrorizing, to spice up the Challenge!
  Discover different Stages as you uncover more Characters, all while having fun in the humorist world of Crackinho!
  Play with Friends and find Hidden Passages or Bonus Levels!
  Train in the field of Martial Arts, unleash your inner strength and find said special moves like "High Dropper", an attack based on Capoeira, or "Fiya Laeza", an Energy Blast from the Tips of your fingers, but never forget to keep an eye on the Mana Bar or else you might end in a tight situation!
  Just like the Old Timer Arcades, once you go forward there is no coming back, so advance in the Stages at your own risk, for the Levels get harder and there are sure to be awesome Boss Fights at the end!
   How long is the game?
  The game is set to have at least 11 different cities to play in. The first level, São Paulo, Brazil takes about 30 minutes to be complete so the rest will take roughly the same amount of time.
 Ok! It’s so nice and clear, but who is Crackinho?
  Crackinho is a superhero who was born in the suburbs of São Paulo. He is the result of an unsuccessful lab experiment. And now he and his group have the mission to discover the origin of these problems and combat social injustices.
The responsible for all of this is a chemist named Dr. Laércio Snow, who created a hallucinogenic and stimulating substance, capable of creating addiction and controlling the entire planet.
Now Crackinho and his gang must fight crime around the world with a good sense of humor.
São Paulo Stage
Tokyo Stage

Rome Stage
We’re at a point right now where the fifth stage of the game is nearly finished. We have already developed the stages for São Paulo - Brazil, Tokyo - Japan, Rome - Italy, Cairo - Egypt and London - England.
São Paulo, Brazil
  Brazil is where it all began and our super hero is gonna fight crime in the dangerous neighborhoods of São Paulo.
Tokyo, Japan
  Welcome to Tokyo 2040! After a flood of Tietê River, São Paulo, Crackinho falls into a manhole and time travels through a tube which takes him to the future.
Rome, Italy
   Crackinho uses his super powers again and time travels straight to 15th century. After throwing his flip-flops to the air, it opens a teleportation portal and he arrives at Rome. Now it's time to combat enemies in Renaissance era.
Cairo, Egypt
 Soundtracks
  We’ve been developing the soundtracks getting inspired on each stage where the game plays.
Have a look at it!
 Why KICKSTARTER and Budget Overview
  With your amazing and generous help we will be able to keep our team filled with talented people and keep up with the schedule of the game, delivering you better content and recurring updates, without sacrificing quality.
 Introducing ourselves:
  Illustrators and Animators
We have a team composed of 6 very talented game designers and illustrators.
Designers
The 2 UI/UX designers are qualified professionals who would like to continue creating and developing the project.
Soundtracks
Fábio Mozine is the creative mind who is composing soundtracks for the 11 stages of the game.
ScoreDraw is our friendly partner who is developing the sound effects and narratives.
Marketing
All we know marketing is crucial nowadays and we’re lucky to have DeSeip by our side helping us to spread this project all over the globe.
Co-Working Space
Black Onyx Interactive has the pleasure to share a nice atmosphere with creative people at Talent Garden Dublin, Ireland and Milan, Italy.
Hardware/Software
Invest in hardware and licenses, especially of Software Development Kits, which helps us convert the game's code to other platforms.
Translation
We’re looking for help with translation to various languages, including and not limited to, English, Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, French and Japanese.
Shipping
Consider Manufacturing and Shipping Costs for the rewards.
Kickstarter will, of course, inhale 5% of our funding goal if we are successfully funded, which adds up to at least this amount.
 Who we are
  Established in 2016 focusing on assisting other companies to develop their software, Black Onyx Interactive had created several robust apps and games along these years.
In late 2018 we became a 100% game development company with insanely technical and artistic excellence in our own games ever since. Based in Dublin, Ireland and recently in Milan, Italy, we have years’ experience in illustration, animation, 3D and programming.
Our team is working hard to release more complex and ambitious titles directed for PC and consoles. From designers, illustrators and animators to developers, we are proud to have our projects developed by people from different nationalities, cultures and beliefs. All of that brings us mental enrichment.
 Who exactly is working on this project?
  Crackinho Beat’ em up in the World is being developed by 14 nice people from Black Onyx Interactive:
Artur Augusto: Game Designer.
Claire Dubois: Sound Designer.
Diones Ignacio: Illustrator and Animator.
Emanuela Lambusta: Illustrator and Animator.
Hermes Mercurio: Illustrator and Animator.
Inês Borges: UI Designer.
João Costa: Illustrator and Animator.
Julio Falcone: Sr Programmer, Game Designer.
Lucas Ferrari: Illustrator and Animator.
Marcelo Milo: Lead Game Designer and Producer.
Marco Silva: Content Designer.
Mark Whitty: 3D designer.
Raíssa Kellermann: Video Editor and Writer.
Ricardo Kindler: Project Manager.
Apart from that, we also have by our side:
DeSeip: Marketing – Milan, Italy
Fábio Mozine, Läjä Records: Soundtracks – Vila Velha, Brazil
ScoreDraw: Sound Effects, Sound Design – Belfast, UK
Antonio Gennaro Law Firm: Legal Advice - Milan, Italy

 Thank you / Obrigado / Gracias / Grazie / Merci / Arigato
  Thank you very much for passing by and taking the time to learn more about this project of ours. Although we don't have an exact release date yet we are aiming for releasing the game on the first semester of 2020, so stay tuned for updates on our social media:
Website: www.blackonyx.ie/
Facebook: www.facebook.com/crackinhobeatemup
Instagram: www.instagram.com/blackonyxlabs/
