campaign.story:
Guinea Pig Parkour is a completely hand-drawn 2D platformer with adventure elements, drawing heavy inspiration from '90s animated cartoons and games.  It is being animated and developed completely by one person (Jeff Mumm).  Music and SFX by Fat Bard.
 In Guinea Pig Parkour, you are, appropriately enough, a guinea pig that does parkour.  You're also in the '90s.  Like totally in the '90s.
 Coffee is the source of your energy.  I mean, if you're like me, it probably is the source of your energy.  But I meant in the game - it's the source of Joe's energy.  
...Joe's the guinea pig.
There's more to Guinea Pig Parkour than just parkour.  When you go indoors or into certain areas, platforming gives way to a more classic adventure game style experience, allowing you to talk to, interact with, and annoy other characters.
When you're a guinea pig, the plumber is a formidable enemy.  You must escape intact before your soul is plunged from your body.
 Each animation in Guinea Pig Parkour is completely hand-drawn by me from scratch, and animated at 24 frames per second, to capture the full, fluid quality of traditional animation, to its best potential.
How I made the tourist.
How I made the coffee chatters.
How I made the plumber boss.
Here's a time-lapse of the process, 10 hours of work in 30 seconds.
 The music and sound for Guinea Pig Parkour is being created by Fat Bard.
 Guinea Pig Parkour is being developed in Construct 3, which has native exporting to Windows, Macintosh, Linux, and Xbox One.  Windows will be my primary focus, but if Construct is able to seamlessly publish to the other platforms, I will do so.  If all goes well, I will also pursue porting to Nintendo Switch and Playstation.
 English will be the only language available to begin with, but I will pursue localization when possible. 
 My biggest inspirations for Guinea Pig Parkour were the games I played growing up in the '90s, especially games that were cartoony or hand-drawn.  GPP actually began as sort of an homage to Disney's Aladdin for the Super Nintendo, but has grown and developed over time.
Some of my other big influences are Earthworm Jim, Sam and Max: Hit the Road, Day of the Tentacle, Yoshi's Island, Crash Bandicoot 2, and Super Mario 64. 
The strongest inspiration for Guinea Pig Parkour as a concept was my childhood desire to play a video game that felt like you were inside a cartoon.
 I'm a solo developer and an independent animator.
 I've been drawing since I could hold a pencil.  I started as a young child drawing my own "Children's Book" styled stories with drawings.  I then made a natural transition to comics, and started experimenting with animation in Mario Paint for the Super Nintendo and with stop-motion animation.  I continued experimenting with digital animation with any program I could find (which were hard to find back then, at least for a kid).  Around the fifth grade, I learned QBasic and made little text adventure games, as well as started making custom maps for Doom II, and started editing Doom II graphics, making my own characters from eight angles - a bit tedious, but amazing to see my characters come to life in a video game!
In high school, I experimented with the Games Factory, Flash animation and continued drawing my comics.  After graduating, I went to school for graphic design, then to a little cartooning school where I studied comics, and finally to an animation school, where I formally learned hand-drawn animation and really refined my artistic skills.  My shifting focus put me in more student debt than I would have wanted, but the learning experience was invaluable.
After animation school, I decided not to pursue animation for hire, as my goal has always been to be an independent artist.  Instead, I worked doing data entry, which allowed me to save all my creative energy for my own projects.   
 The main character of Guinea Pig Parkour is a guinea pig named Joe, who is actually based on my childhood pet guinea pig of the same name.  I started drawings comics and animations about Joe in the third grade.  I continued by making webcomics and some experimental games about Joe from 1998 to 2004.  I then went on to explore other projects, but in 2010, I created "Guinea Something Good" - a new take on my childhood character in the form of comic strips and animated shorts.  In 2012, I started developing a new game based on "Guinea Something Good," and in 2015 I devoted all my creative time to creating this project.
Joe was my pet during the time I was playing the games that influenced GPP.  For me, making Guinea Pig Parkour is, in many ways, a lifelong dream.
 Joe is an average guinea pig, stuck in a cage with other guinea pigs.  One day, his owner spills a cup of coffee, and Joe drinks some out of curiosity.  Instantaneously, he is transformed into the tracksuit-wearing, parkour-performing guinea pig we see in the game!  He is off to explore the world of the '90s, including real life locations like the bedroom, as well as venturing inside paintings, pictures and other hidden worlds.
Perform parkour in '90s inspired worlds through action platforming.
Explore open worlds, with mission based objectives (à la Super Mario 64).
Talk and interact with other characters, pick up items, solve puzzles in the style of '90s graphic adventure games.
Fight enemies by jumping, kicking, and more.
Encounter an interesting boss in every world.  
 I will aim at launching on Early Access by December 2020.  From there, I will continue to polish the game and improve it until it is ready for official release. 
The Kickstarter funds will go toward allowing me to work full time on the game until it is ready for Early Access, as well as for the music and sound.
  I am a solo developer, and I have a unique vision.  I've always done my best work on my own, and I would like to retain that level of creative control for this project. Kickstarter will allow me to make the game I want to make without compromises.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenges for this project are that it is my first video game, and, besides music and sound, that I am a one man operation. However, this is why I've chosen to chunk down the game into smaller, more manageable, achievable goals. The goal for the Kickstarter is to get into Early Access because I have completed enough projects and done enough work on the game to know I can accomplish this. From there, with the help of the community, I know I can get a short episode completed and released. Once a complete episode has been released, I will have had enough experience to then confidently create new episodes. I dream big, but at the end of the day, I am a very pragmatic, hard-working person. Small, targeted goals lead to big results.

updates.update_content: Eddie Deezen has agreed to join the Super Inconvenience Mart team! It's easily one  of the coolest things that has ever happened to me! Here he is first draft, in the style of Malvin from WarGames. It's fitting because the  game takes place in the 80's, and relies heavily on 80's computer technology.   When I talked with Eddie, he expressed that he wanted to do a voice over for the character. I explained it was currently unfortunately not in the budget. My hope is that once the game is released, it will generate enough revenue to allow for voice acting in tandem with the texts, for later released/updated versions. For anyone concerned about my health, I am recovering quite well, and life is more or less getting back to normal. _mgmt P.S. Hope all is well with you guys! Enjoy your day!

I don't know how many of you follow my facebook account, but I had a stroke and was hospitalized on February 14th. Anyways, I seem to be recovering day by day, but I'd be lying if I said it didn't set me back a little. At any rate, the one thing I love, and the only thing I live for is 'Super Inconvenience Mart', and I am working as best as I can to complete it as soon as possible. _Zach

So lately I've really been getting into the music, and final music for the game. I also would like to mention that the music will be optional, and the volume for the music, and the game sound fx will be user controlled. I wanted to show you all a song that I've been working on in the past few days. It's my first song of the new year. I wrote it after watching "Christine" 3 to 4 times in a row. It's not a horror game, but I want the music to  convey a cinematic feeling of uneasiness, where you know that "Not all  is well in the world". I kept it as minimal as possible intentionally. I'd prefer it if you play it on a decent stereo system, or through a nice pair of headphones to get the whole cinematic affect, if you can.

Hello everyone! 

I've been in ill health as of recent, and apologize for the delay between updates. Despite how I've been feeling, I never stop working on the game. I had originally aimed at having it released in October this year, but realistically it probably wont be ready until second quarter 2021. I've inadvertently gotten a LOT better at scripting/programming within the language I am using for the game, and significantly better at set lighting/room building. With the increased quality in those areas, the games overall scope has increased beyond what I had originally anticipated, and thus it is taking longer to finish as a result. I'm posting a video to show the recent sets I have been working on, and will have some more game play footage in the near future.

campaign.story:
3 Minutes to Midnight is an adventure game brought to life by Scarecrow Studio—a small, passionate team—and is unlike any you have ever seen before.
Most fans of point-and click-games would assume this is a pretty straightforward adventure game with a beginning and an end. But... what if that wasn't the case? What if every action you took had consequences? What if each puzzle had truly and wildly different solutions? Sounds pretty revolutionary, right?
Follow Betty Anderson and Eliza Barret as they unravel a mystery in their sleepy little New Mexico town. With over 15 hours of gameplay, charismatic art, breathtaking environments, and a colorful cast of characters—each of whom has extensive dialogues and intricate backstories—this game will keep you glued to the screen. 
It also boasts droves of items—each with its own customized description and special role—to use in the game’s complex, challenging, and enthralling puzzles.
We spend 100% of our time developing 3 Minutes to Midnight (it would be a higher percentage if we could bend time and space!), but sometimes we post crazy stuff or interesting news, so if you happen to be on Twitter, you might want to follow us by clicking the link below.   
Of course, if you’d rather follow us on Instagram, we normally post images from events we attend, or everyday studio life. Just click the link below so you can stay tuned.   
Or take the direct approach! Hop into our Discord and chat with your fellow 3 Minutes to Midnight fans!   
Wait, you’re saying you prefer Facebook? Awesome, because we are there too! Hit the button below, and like our page. We insist.     
Do you like tubes? So do we, that’s why we have a YouTube channel! Visit us for the latest video releases and trailers for 3 Minutes to Midnight!    
If you work for the media or are a content creator, and want more information about the game or about the studio, click here or on the image below to access our press kit. You can also reach us at press@scarecrow-studio.com if you have any other press related inquiries.  
It's the late 1940s and somewhere, in the middle of nowhere, a loud explosion shatters the night. A plucky teenager wakes up with a jolt. Where is she? WHO is she?
Turns out she is Betty Anderson, and whatever blew up in the desert seems to have wiped her memory clean, but as she’ll soon learn, Betty has a lot more to worry about than amnesia. Like, say, a town full of people who aren’t what they seem, an overly ambitious mayor, a top-secret military base, the mafia, and a potbellied pig with a vendetta. Then there’s this little problem of a doomsday plot counting down to the extinction of the human race… but she'll get to that later.
Join Betty to crack the conspiracy that starts with a bang and ends at 3 Minutes to Midnight—if we’re lucky.
Classic adventure gameplay
Inspired by such titles as The Secret of Monkey Island, Day of the Tentacle, and Sam & Max Hit the Road—3 Minutes to Midnight combines the point-and-click gameplay and clever humor with high-definition cartoon art, an intuitive interface, and a compelling mystery.  
Two playable characters
Play as plucky teenager Betty Anderson and the ambitious and diplomatic mayor Eliza Barret—two characters on opposite sides of the spectrum—to unravel a plot much deeper than one would surmise at first glance.
 A small town of strangers and secrets, all deeply connected 
All the characters in the game—as well as the world they live in—have a rich and detailed backstory, with clever and unexpected ties to each other. Scratching the surface won’t be enough to discover more than their apparent identities.
Puzzles up the wazoo 
Everyone knows that puzzles can make or break an adventure game. (Cat hair mustaches, anyone?) After all, most of the challenge comes from figuring out solutions to these convoluted problems. What’s worse than puzzles that are too hard or too easy, though? Having to solve the same kind of puzzle over and over until you feel like eating your controller out of frustration.
That’s why we’ve made a special effort to vary the types of puzzles in 3 Minutes to Midnight. You may need to talk to other people in town to figure out an answer—or to get yourself out of a real mess. Some puzzles are progressive, meaning one decision early in the game could dramatically influence how you find answers. The environment may hold clues, but you might also have to rely on your own inherent knowledge. 
With over 1000 interactable objects and the largest script in point-and-click history, players will be able to use their creativity to figure out many different solutions. In turn, these decisions can influence the outcome of the game and affect which ending the player sees. When we say this game can be replayed, we’re really not kidding! 
Replayability
We’re talking hidden dialogue, events, and characters that you might otherwise never see. Maybe that character you kept hearing about wasn't actually real. Or maybe he was… and just very well hidden.
Multiple solutions to some puzzles
Most of our big puzzles have been designed in such a way that there's sometimes more than just the obvious solution. You might find an easy way to solve a problem, or maybe you'll find a secret that unlocks more information about the backstory of our characters.  
Multiple endings!
When we said replayability, we meant it! The game offers multiple endings, each of them distinct from the others. The endings are drastically different and are determined by how you play the game, giving real stakes to the story. Some finales may be happier than others, so pay attention to your choices! No need to fear “multiple endings” where the only differences are that the ending cinematics have the camera tilted at a weird angle and everything is tinted some random color—we guarantee it. 

 Elaborate hint system 
Our built-in hint system will highlight important objects and assist during those tense dialogue options. After all, we wouldn’t want you to get lost (or look for a walkthrough online!) So if you have the need, activate this option... or don't.
 "That doesn't seem to work."—No more! 
“That doesn’t work” is now a thing of the past! No more will you be stuck hearing the same phrase 5000 times in a row, because we made sure to write 5000 lines of unique dialogue specifically for this reason! All of them clever and funny, of course, for you to discover at your leisure.  
Easter eggs
Wait, what’s this you picked up off the ground? An Easter egg! During Betty’s (mis)adventures, you’ll have the chance to find lots of Easter eggs. They’re not all three-second jokes or random background details, though. We’re talking elaborate hidden gems. Remember what happened to Guybrush if you left him soaking for too long? If you do, you’ll know exactly what we mean. If not, don’t worry—you’ll develop your own set of elaborate in-jokes once you play the game. Like Ben Zinn’s plumbing, humor is wildly creative and slightly dangerous. (See, that’s an in-joke you don’t get... yet.)
Hidden references
Consider yourself genre-savvy? Maybe you watch a lot of movies? Then you’ll definitely enjoy hunting for cleverly hidden references to other great works. They may appear as witty book titles or hard-to-spot cameos, but don’t worry—they won’t be taking center stage. After all, 3 Minutes to Midnight has its own stories to tell.
Yes, we made sure to include at least one Star Wars reference... original trilogy, of course. 
We’ve ensured an expansive and interesting gameplay experience. In fact, we might’ve gone a bit overboard. Early testing of the game took about 12 hours! Considering there was no dialogue and that we knew exactly what we were doing… you’d probably think we’re crazy! So, get yourselves ready for 15 to 20 exciting hours of gameplay.
But don’t worry, our game isn't long because it's clunky. We’ve introduced many quality of life improvements. Want to leave a location faster? Double-click the exit! Feeling lost? Use the hint system. Re-entered a dialogue by mistake? Skip it! Then again, maybe you won’t want to.
Have we mentioned that our characters have both expressive faces and bodies? It just makes everything so much more dynamic. Take a look below...

If you're one of those hardcore keyboard-and-mouse players, you’ll appreciate the amount of work that went into making its controls as smooth as possible. On the other hand, if you swear by a controller, you’ll get to experience the best controls ever developed for a point-and-click game. 
All characters are fully integrated with the game’s backgrounds, thanks to shadow and coloring systems specifically designed for this title. Dynamic lighting affects every scene. No character will ever look like a cardboard cutout in a bad Saturday cartoon show.  
The game offers multiple solutions to different puzzles, with many, many conditions that lock or unlock certain information or events. 
Here’s a bit of gameplay for you to enjoy. The first half of the video is brand-new 4K footage exclusive to our Kickstarter, with voice acting and sound effects not yet implemented. If you want to enjoy our talented voice cast, the second half of the video—which is from a demo shown at worldwide events like Gamescom, PAX East, and E3—will give you a fuller experience. Don’t worry, though, we made sure there are no spoilers. For real, we checked. Several times.
Our game has over 50 characters aside from Betty and Eliza, each with an intriguing backstory, and many of them interconnected. While you unravel the main plot of the game, you’ll learn more about every single one of them—if you want to, that is. Discover hidden dialogues and the special events they lead to. Only the most expert of adventurers will be able to unlock this game in full!
Now, how about we meet some of the townsfolk?   
We want to make the best-looking point-and-click adventure game of all time. That’s why we have some of the best artists working on it. Environments look familiar? That might be because our environment artist, David Puerta, worked on such titles like Yesterday, Runaway, and Broken Sword.
We’ve created a huge number of locations for you to explore. All of our backgrounds are painted in 8K resolution and converted to 4K for the final version of the game. Most are panoramic, allowing us to show you beautiful parallax effects and leaving you with even more to discover. But enough explaining, why not take a look? 
Some of our environments are even available during both day and night. Gameplay and situations change with the time of day, and so will the people you encounter.
It’s taken us three years to craft 3 Minutes to Midnight’s script. Over FIVE people have worked to make sure the script is rich and engaging, engineered to keep you guessing and on the edge of your seat.
Every item, or combination of items, is accompanied by a humorous comment. Some may be more subtle than others, but we think they’re all good for a laugh. Examine any interactable item for a chuckle… as well as a clue.
That’s why you can trust us when we say every aspect of the game has been treated with the utmost care and respect, and the script is no exception. We value a good story as much as we do our art and our game’s integrity.

Most of us have our favorite tunes from these old adventure games stuck in our heads, and no matter how much time passes, their greatness never fades away. We’ve put a lot of thought into developing our soundtrack, choosing only the best in Guy Jones, an award-winning composer for TV, video games, and film. He had the task to create these themes specifically for our game, and he delivered. Nothing beats translating visual art into music! 
Here are a few pieces from our score for you to enjoy:
3 Minutes to Midnight OST - Cahoon Park, Soon To Be Barret Park
3 Minutes to Midnight OST - The Rhino Sleeps Tonight
3 Minutes to Midnight OST - Urgent Repairs, No Matter How Long It Takes
ScareMixer
As spooky as it sounds, the ScareMixer is a thing of beauty. Despite its name, we don’t use it to mix scares, but to make sure every musical theme in the game is treated with great respect. No longer will you notice those jarring cuts in audio that you hate so much, seamless transitions from track to track are the way of the future—and that’s why ScareMixer was born. Anyone else thinking about iMUSE™️ right now? You got the idea. Now, how about we show you what we’re talking about... 
Great legends of point-and-click, like Roberta & Ken Williams, Ron Gilbert, Tim Schafer, Dave Grossman, David Fox, Steve Purcell, Peter Chan, Hal Barwood, Al Low, Brian Moriarty, Gary Winnick, Charles Cecil… and many more! 
But let’s not stick to just personalities. A lot of legendary shows and movies also inspired 3 Minutes to Midnight. We’ll play it safe to avoid spoilers, but if you can fathom The Twilight Zone and Monkey Island having a baby… that’d be pretty close to 3 Minutes to Midnight.
We have many brilliant influences, some of whom were instrumental in shaping our childhoods. They've given us many memories that will stay with us until the end of our days, but how about we make some new ones, too? 
What our studio intends to do is bring the point-and-click genre to the next level. At some juncture, adventure games turned to 3D as the next step in their evolution and—while it worked for some of them (like the amazing Grim Fandango)—it was not the case for many, many others that tried that approach.  
We’re firm believers of 2D point-and-click adventure games, but what if, besides a breathtaking main plot, we implemented other awesome features like 4K graphics, adaptive soundtracks with seamless transitions, post-processing, backstories for every single character, fluid and gorgeous animations for every action, decisions and consequences that shape the game’s several endings? All of that plus a hint system, the ability to play with keyboard and mouse as well as game controllers, tons of replayability, and a very long list of etceteras. 
Over the past two years, we have received very positive feedback from our community and the press, which keeps us motivated and helps bring us closer to the finish line. Our first game, 3 Minutes to Midnight, will be released in spring/summer 2020. 

When 3 Minutes to Midnight was but a fever dream almost three years ago, we had a clear vision of what we wanted—and went for it! This is our first game, and our lack of experience made some steps in this arduous process take longer.
No matter what, though, we've never lost our forward momentum. We have one clear objective—to create one of the best point-and-click adventure games ever made. It’s no easy task, but our passion and effort are reflected in every little detail. Nothing, no matter how minor, has been neglected. 
A few months ago, while working on secondary plots for our characters, we realized that if we truly wanted to make them justice, we'd need to expand many aspects of the game a considerable amount.
We want to do it, but we also know that in order to accomplish such feats, we need your help! We want to work together with our fans to create a new point-and-click game that will occupy a special spot in your heart—just like the great games of old.
3 Minutes to Midnight will be fully voiced in English. However, the game will feature subtitles in English, German, French, Italian, and Spanish. Later followed by Russian, Portuguese, Czech, Polish, Chinese (Simplified and Traditional), Korean, and Japanese translations a few months after release.
Our aim is to release the game on Windows, Mac, and Linux, and shortly after on Switch, Xbox One, and PS4. There are plans for mobile support for Android and iOS, but this is dependent on stretch goals and will take more time. For now, the game is being released on Steam. There are ongoing talks to bring the game to GOG but at an early stage, so we can’t confirm anything at this point. However, we’d like to have the game available on as many platforms as possible.
We know how important it is for our backers to be able to choose a DRM-free version. Therefore, you will be able to choose your preferred platform in a survey we will be sending out after the campaign is over. However, please keep in mind, this campaign is only for the Windows, Mac, and Linux versions.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve been self-funded for the past three years, but due to delays and bumps in the road—par for the course when you’re an indie team working on your first big project—we’re going to need an extra push if we don’t want these three years of work going down the drain! With enough funding, we can deliver a product that will take your breath away. We’ve planned all of the game’s stages for days on end, the script has been thoroughly checked to be as entertaining as possible, and the art is gorgeous.

But that final product won’t come to pass unless you give us the support we need to push through and get the last step done. In the end, the fate of this game depends on you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Don't Worry, We Haven't Stopped Working
updates.update_content:
Hello, our wonderful backers!
It’s been a while, has it not? We understand you might have wanted to hear from us much earlier, and for that we apologize.
However, know that our silence doesn’t mean the project is dead, canceled, or anything of the sort. We’re still alive and kicking, and the project is progressing nicely. Just so we’re all on the same page, here’s what we’ve been dealing with over the past few months:

We’re back to talk about 3 Minutes to Midnight during these festivities.
As it stands, progress is going along smoothly, and as far as things we can talk about, we’re very glad to tell you guys that we have a small surprise this time around. We know we teased Betty’s items being nearly done, but we put some great effort these last weeks, and we can say Betty’s items are 100% complete. But want to know what’s better? Eliza’s items are completely done too!

Hello, you wonderful backers!
Our campaign is coming to a close! We know, we know, we’re as sad as you are, but it’s not over yet! There are still 24 hours remaining on the countdown of this particular doomsday clock and many stretch goals to meet!
Now, whether you want to help us meet our stretch goals because you want the game in your native language, are very curious about what this deal with these evil chipmunks is, or because you’re just in a generous mood today, you still have time and things you can do to help out!

campaign.story:
With the basic goal reached, it's time to think about Stretch Goals!  
Something obscure is crawling behind the dazzling glaze of Miami, a force that goes beyond the usual human concept of science and religion. There is a silent, latent war going on, a war able to shatter the foundations of civilization, harnessing ancient knowledge and mystical arts lost for centuries. Get ready to face a long and dangerous journey. 
It might be the last.  
The Hand of Glory is an adventure game inspired by the golden age of point and click, especially by the Broken Sword and Gabriel Knight sagas.
Find out who kidnapped Elke Mulzberg and unveil a mystery that has its roots in alchemy and esoterism!
More than 15 hours of gameplay
Thousands of dialogue lines
Dozens of puzzles to solve   
Control Lars and Alice and explore Miami and Italy in wonderful 2D Full-HD locations
Original atmospheric soundtrack and full English voice-over  
 We are here on Kickstarter because we need your help to complete work on The Hand of Glory. Even though the game is nearly complete through internally funding, we still have to record voices and add a series of finishing touches that we can't really do without your help! And we’ve prepared a dope series of exclusive rewards that will never be available after this campaign! Here's where the money will go towards: 
PLAY

Stop for a second and sail with us on a quick trip.  

You're on Mêlée Island and ready to do anything to become a mighty pirate, including sliding on a rope with the help of a rubber chicken with a pulley in the middle.  You're in Lochmarne, Ireland, on the trail of a serial killer disguised as a clown (or emperor penguin, or leprechaun) when you come to grips with the worst of your enemies: a malevolent goat. 
You're in Rennes-le-Château, immersed in the mysteries of the Languedoc, and you run into one of the most intricate puzzle of all time: Le Serpent Rouge.  
We can go on, because the challenges you've faced already are endless. But now it's time for you to embark on a completely new journey! 

 Interact! 
Get ready to fill your pockets with all sorts of crazy stuff!
Solve puzzles!
Examine the crime scenes, gather clues, interview witnesses. YOU are in charge of the investigation.
Learn kinesics!
Alice observes and provides explanations for people's movements/behaviour to help you understand their motives.

We want the player to feel completely immersed in the game world, so we’ve chosen locations that are real places where you can actually go. Here is where the adventures of our brave detective will happen! 

Miami, Florida 
The Sun is always shining on Miami!

Imposing skyscrapers, sunny beaches, music, golden sand. These and much more constitute the heart and soul of one of the most recognizable cities in the world: Miami, kissed by the sun all year long!  
But remember: the brighter the light, the darker the shadow it generates. 
More than 65 locations to explore!
San Leo, Italy 
'Making of'  of the "San Leo" location! 

The esoteric side of the tale leads to Italy, and in particular to a medieval town in Emilia Romagna, called San Leo.  
We obtained official patronage by the town (of which we’re very proud) and received active and stimulating cooperation, which allowed us to faithfully reproduce many real places rich in history and mystery.  
Piazza Dante Alighieri in San Leo, Italy
Explore this fascinating borough and prepare to bring to light secrets buried for centuries under a net of conspiracies, historic machinations and events that normal science can’t explain! 
In The Hand of Glory you will interact with more than 30 characters! Let's meet some of them!
 Alice Sharp - Making of 
Let's admit it: being able to play an adventure game in your own language is becoming a luxury nowadays. The reasons are many, but we can narrow them to just the main one: budget.  Many developers are forced to stick to English even for subtitles, and this limits the game experience for those who don't know this language fluently.  
That's why we decided to make the effort to translate our free demo in as many languages as we could, to offer a glimpse into how it could be to play the game in your language, thanks to the support of the WARLOCS, who will take care of all the text localization of the full game as well. 
These are the languages we translated the demo in
 We'd really like to translate the game in as many languages as possible, but it's nearly impossible for a new indie team with a limited budget. That's where you come into play: we will produce the game in English (voice and subtitles) and Italian (subtitles) - your support in this campaign will decide the other languages, as explained in the image below. 
Now it's up to you! Spread the word about the campaign in your circle of friends, as we hope that 50 backers is an attainable goal to be able to enjoy a PROFESSIONAL localization in your native tongue! 
You skipped everything else to get immediately to this section, right? Then now, without further ado, here are the rewards that you can get your hands on by pledging to our Kickstarter campaign! 
 Part of the cast: This is your chance to physically enter the world of THOG. Lend your appearance and voice (in your language!) to a character who will be included in the game for Lars to interact with!   
Sponsorship*: You're a developer/company and you want to share some of the 'Glory'? Here's your chance to do just that! Your trailer or a promotional image will be included in a clever way in THOG, for everyone to see it!   
*We reserve the right to NOT accept content of dubious racist or sexist nature. 
Pledging for an add-on is really easy!
If you want any add-ons, you just have to add the following amount to the reward you've selected. 
 About the "Mysterious Scroll"
At this point you're probably wondering what this "Mysterious Scroll" is that you've been reading about among the rewards. Basically it's going to be a fictitious (but realistic) medieval scroll containing a suggestive, ancient speech.  
  Please note: this is just a concept!
The scroll will also contain a hidden message that will allow you to unlock a secret scene... if you're able to decipher it!
We're a small team, but we love what we do and we truly believe point and click adventures still have a lot to give!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Producing a video game is not an easy task: you have to struggle against deadlines, budget balancing, bugs and the development itself. But since the team has experience with these kinds of challenges, we’re confident we will be able to carry out this project with minimal risk.

Furthermore, you will be able to follow the development process in real time through our constant updates, our social media channels and our email contacts. For our part, we will be as transparent as we can, always listening to your advice and your feedback.

We only have one goal: deliver the best possible game to you guys!

updates.update_userinfo: Update #17: Release date and new format announced
updates.update_content:
ENGLISH
Hi guys! Today we want to update you  with  a few news  announcements about  the game release and its format. Let’s start with the latter: after long thought, we have reached the decision to split the game into two parts. This decision is to be considered  purely authorial, with no other reasons than narrative ones.  We  just feel that what happens  at the midpoint of the game is too intense to be  treated  as a simple cut-scene that links one scenario to another. We want you to dwell on it for a while and assimilate instead of rushing towards the conclusion of the journey. Therefore, the “episodic” division will remain even when Part 2 is released, just like you’re watching two seasons of a TV show.

We are fully aware that many players don’t like to play in “parts,” but this is how we feel is best experienced. Of course you are welcome  to wait and “binge” both parts together, as it’s totally up to you, but . It certainly  won’t  be a short trip anyway: , and you should add another few hours if you want to see all the achievements and  Easter eggs we have planned.

I hope you all can understand our decision and come to embrace it for the reason intended – trust us, it’s better this way.

campaign.story:
Click the image to Download the Demo!
Norrune, the City of Oil Rigs, is constantly teetering on the verge of detonation. Heated political turmoil has ignited widespread civil unrest as protests, riots, violence and crime have been building pressure and it is only a matter of time before this powder-keg of a city goes off. The world of Combustion is dark, chaotic and unjust … but still worth fighting for. 
Norrune features 5 Unique Locations
The people, in their repression of their inner nature, struggle to find a means in which to express it. Order, chaos and the nuances in-between. All the while Calico, having shut off his emotions for years, is forced to battle his own demons. 
Frustration, depression and even apathy
Single-Player Combat
Armed with a retractable electric baton and a suppression shield, Calico will confront suspects and criminals in any way he can. With a combat system akin to Brave Fencer Musashi, where blocking, dodging and timing your attacks are critical, Calico will walk a fine line between appropriate force and excessive brutality in his pursuit to restore order.
Attack & Block
Stun & Snare
VR Training Missions
Police Work
Being a policeman is about much more than just busting heads. Calico’s duty is to maintain the law and as such, you'll be heavily incentivized to arrest suspects, perform emergency service work, call in anything suspicious and protect the lives of civilians.
You never know who you can trust
When there’s no time, you gotta do things yourself
Leveling
Strength, Stamina and Health, Combustion has a streamlined set of stats to keep the pace high and yet give you control over how you prefer to play. Earn experience from all manner of police work, from apprehending suspects to rescuing civilians.
Set your starting stats
Arrest Suspects for Bonus XP
Communication
Equipped with a cellphone, Calico is in constant contact with his colleagues and associates. They’ll offer guidance and insight and the occasional anecdote, and perhaps can even help Calico with his personal struggles.
Otacon?!
Exploration
Combustion rewards exploration, with so many items to use and interact with, NPCs to communicate with and interrogate, and many place to visit. Turn on a TV to watch a broadcast, buy some soda from a vending machine, or find a terrified citizen cowering behind crates. The locations Calico finds himself in keep so much of their secrets in the shadows.
Buy a soda or watch some TV
Boxes always hide something good
Cutscenes
If there’s one thing the early 3D era in gaming did with such unabashed pride was its cutscenes. Combustion will feature similar camera work, hitting that mark of hubris that the retro era had done so well but with the mindfulness and brevity that Calico’s story deserves.
Style and Substance? Now there's a rare mix.
Cinematic Camera
Like Metal Gear Solid, Parasite Eve and Silent Hill, Combustion features fixed camera angles that automatically bring you back to the late 90s. And while the player-controlled cameras of the 90s were fraught with jank, the fixed cinematic cameras of our favorite games always delivered on enhancing the storytelling. Our camera is carefully utilized to fill each area with distinct emotions: isolation, suspense and despondence.
Cinematic angles set the stage for some great moments.
Use First-Person View to Check Your Surroundings
Low-Poly
Combustion is a retro throwback to the Gen5 consoles of our youth -- The original Playstation, the Nintendo 64 and the Sega Saturn. Featuring a low-poly art-style reminiscent of the early 3D days of gaming, it is in this often unappreciated yet iconic style that the world of Combustion is built. The beauty of low-poly models is in its expressive character designs and simple caricatured worlds. Large polygons and crisp textures are the pixel-art of 3D gaming.
Way less polygons but still just as atmospheric.
Dieselpunk
The technological era in-between steampunk and cyberpunk, Dieselpunk reflects and exaggerates much of our modern era -- Heavy gas-guzzling engines, “Hi-tech” CRT monitors and the giant oil rigs dotted across our oceans. Made famous by games like Final Fantasy 7 and Oddworld, this rusty, grimey and all-around industrial design permeates the entirety of the game’s aesthetics.
I’d buy tickets to this show.
Character must be based on a real-life animal and fit inside the setting of Combustion. Retro Dungeon reserves the right to adjust characters.
Retro Dungeon is a small group of collaborators with big ideas. Based in Europe, they work from different countries to lend their talents to projects they are passionate about.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Kickstarter is great, but it's also quite easy for a developer to get ahead of themselves. Therefore the scope of this kickstarter can seem conservative and restrained, but it is to ensure the game's creation within a scope that's set as realistically as possible. 

Any kickstarter, especially within game development runs a risk of not being finished. This is why the game's demo and pre-production was developed so extensively before this kickstarter so all the core systems and designs were in place to where it's an issue of adding quantity and refining quality rather than develop entirely new systems. This also helps in the estimation of time for said content.

updates.update_content:
Hello
Here for another update. While a big load of work have been happening with the game's code, in particular an easy to use dialogue system that factors in multiple choice dialogue trees, animations and having translation capacity, there's still fun stuff to show.
Get In Shape

Hello, backers! 
Been too long since the last update. 
Today I want to show you a bit of the things that have been going on. 
That's Not How It Happened

Hello everyone!
I hope you are all well. Just a small progress update before bigger things. :)

Hello everyone! 
Here comes a new update after quite a bit of wait since last. I have things to show that I hope will make up for it.

New Action System
Thanks to the incredible help of fellow game developer Molegato, I have been able to redo the majority of Combustion’s input system with his ActionCharacterSystem. The input and state system of Combustion has been broken down and rebuilt with this system.

 He accepts paid commission-work and runs a himself for lowpoly fans and creators. Great guy.

Thank You Everyone, Once Again
A year ago, Combustion was fully funded and what a year it has been. Tough, but educational and the project continues with better traction than ever. (Just wish there were more hours in the day) 
Thank you for your patience and interest and big thanks to the growing and supporting community.

Hello!
This new update has mostly one major update and that is the debug room release and testing group. 
Debug Room Release

Hello Everyone!
Back again with a new monthly kickstarter post to share some choice pieces of what has been made.

campaign.story:
It’s the 1920s and the world’s foremost detective is about to embark on his most challenging case yet. A mysterious invitation to an isolated island results in a grizzly murder and a race against time to track down the killer. Thankfully, in this world that’s not quite like our own, there’s nobody better to crack the case than the great detective and gentleman giraffe, Lord Winklebottom.  
Join Lord Winklebottom and his steadfast companion Dr Frumple as they investigate the murder of their old friend. Uncover clues, interview suspects and solve puzzles to crack the case, capture the killer and uncover the horrifying dark secret at the heart of the Isle of Barghest!
Download the demo (available on Windows, macOS and Linux) that was playable at Adventure X (with a few tweaks!) to get a taste of the game. This teaser contains unique content that won't appear in the final game, so no need to worry about spoilers! 
As well as the original English text and voice acting, the demo is now also available with German, Italian, Spanish, Russian and Japanese text translations!
The final game will feature improved voice acting, animation and audio, as well as an in-game note system. For now, we recommend writing down notes as you play to help you solve the puzzles. If you need any hints or help, get in touch via #help on our Discord. 
As well as Steam there will also be a DRM-free release! 
Not to mention the one and only, Tim Schafer!
Lord Winklebottom Investigates is a game set in a version of the 1920s entirely populated by animals. Inspired by the likes of Agatha Christie and Sherlock Holmes, the game is a classic murder mystery with a bizarre twist. 
Invited to the desolate Isle of Barghest by his childhood friend, Admiral Gilfrey, Lord Winklebottom arrives to find that Gilfrey is dead! The family maid, Beryl, made the gruesome discovery while undertaking her daily duties.
Suspecting foul play and trapped on the island by a storm, Winklebottom must investigate the murder, interrogate the suspects and get to the bottom of the many strange things going on on the island.
Lord Winklebottom Investigates is a point and click adventure game full of perplexing puzzles, witty dialogue and lots of frightfully well-dressed animals.    
The game will challenge the player to solve the murder of Lord Winklebottom’s childhood friend, Admiral Gilfrey, in a case that will offer many hours of exploration, investigation, puzzle-solving and interrogation.
The game has a streamlined interface that allows you to directly interact with items in the world using simple, context sensitive icons. Just click on an object, and the options available to you will pop up:
Investigate! 
Like all good adventure game protagonists, Lord Winklebottom has mysteriously large pockets that allow him to carry around a slightly implausible number of items at any given time. You can interact with stuff in your inventory using the same icon-based interface, and also drag and drop items to combine them or use them on other things in the game.
Interrogate!
Stick your neck where it’s not wanted and question the other guests and residents of the island to search for potential suspects!
Explore!
Explore outside the mansion deep into the island to uncover the strange secrets that reside there.
The game will be released on Windows, Mac and Linux in April 2020.
Lord Winklebottom will also be able to join you on your travels! As I am a registered Nintendo Switch developer a Switch version will be released in June 2020 to allow time for additional Nintendo QA processes.
Any backers that receive the game will have the choice of any of the above platforms! A survey will be sent out after the Kickstarter has ended for you to state your preference. 
Behold a selection of some of the characters you will encounter on your perilous adventure...
Born into a wealthy family, the young Lord Winklebottom decided to use his privileged position to help those less fortunate than himself. Now the world’s foremost detective, Lord Winklebottom must solve the grisly murder of his old school friend. 
Winklebottom’s longtime companion and friend, Dr Frumple assists Winklebottom with his cases. While he lacks the deductive skills of the great detective, his detailed knowledge of animal anatomy has often proved invaluable.
Winklebottom’s childhood friend, Gilfrey joined the navy at a young age and rose quickly through the ranks. Despite being a freshwater animal, Gilfrey loved the sea and in later years went on many private voyages spanning all four corners of the globe. 
Recently promoted, thanks in no small part to the Winklebottom’s assistance in solving the grizzly case of the Limehouse Lizard Murders and bringing the Whitechapel Weasel Gang to justice, Detective Inspector Culver is sent to the island to aid in the investigation.  Attached to the Special Branch.
The wife of Admiral Gilfrey, Ethelberta died tragically several years ago. On quiet nights, it is said that you can still hear her melancholy quacking drifting across the island.
Lord Winklebottom Investigates is being developed by Cave Monsters, a 1-person game company based in Sheffield in the UK founded by Charlotte Sutherland.
 
        I've worked in the games industry as an animator for around a decade, at a variety of companies including Rare, Tt Games, EA and Sumo Digital. This gave me the chance to work on a number of AAA games such as Little Big Planet 3, Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed and the LEGO games. 
I've always loved adventure games,the first adventure game I ever played was The Curse of Monkey Island (the puzzle with the map tattoo wins best adventure game puzzle ever in my opinion!) and I’ve been a massive Lucas Arts fan ever since. Grim Fandango also holds a big place in my heart as I have a fairly dark sense of humour and I’ve incorporated my love of it into my personal life…   
In 2011 was thrilled to get the chance to work as an animator on the Doctor Who: The Gunpowder Plot for the BBC. Having had this taste of making adventure games, I knew I wanted to make one for my first big solo project. 
I'm a big animal lover and have always been fascinated by both animal biology, anatomy and not forgetting their cuteness!   
I also love detective stories, particularly ones set in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, such as Sherlock Holmes (The Hound of Baskervilles has been a major influence!), Agatha Christie (And Then There Were None is another major influence!) and the Paul Temple mysteries. 
So the naturally, this all developed into the idea of a giraffe detective from the 1920s named Lord Winklebottom! 
The world of Lord Winklebottom is inspired by the detective works of Christie and Conan Doyle, but also draws on the atmosphere and tone of classic horror movies such as the Universal Monsters and Hammer Horror series.
In addition, Grim Fandango's combination of a compelling story and incredible atmosphere with great characters and strong humour is a big influence on the game. 
Combining all these elements makes for a unique point and click adventure, filled with humour, mystery and some good old fashioned horror!
To show our heartfelt appreciation we are offering a fantastic selection of rewards for all ‘Winklebackers’...
A very big thank you! This pack includes access to our backer-only Discord channel, a special backer role on Discord, background wallpapers for both desktop and mobile, as well as your name being in the credits of the game to show our appreciation!
A copy of Lord Winklebottom Investigates upon release on your choice of Windows, Mac, Linux or Switch! A survey will be sent out to all backers after the Kickstarter ends for you to specify your preference. 
A digital PDF art book featuring behind the scenes processes and concept art from the making of Lord Winklebottom Investigates!
Digital copy of the original roaring 20’s inspired soundtrack composed specially for the game! So get your dancing shoes on and get ready to charleston with your fellow mammals! 
A specially designed Lord Winklebottom bookmark exclusive to our Kickstarter backers, so you’ll never lose your place in your murder mystery novels!
  Special edition, exclusive pin badge! Featuring the gentleman giraffe himself in all his glory! Pin it to your lapel, bag, or anything you can pin it to and add an instant touch of class! 
A special edition A3 poster featuring your favourite giraffe detective! Backers will decide on the final design! (final design will be decided by a poll amongst our backers after the Kickstarter ends).
  An exclusive Kickstarter t-shirt, ensuring you look dapper all year around! Backers will decide on the final design! (final design and colour will be decided by a poll amongst our backers after the Kickstarter ends).
  Play a hand (or a hoof) with a set of stylish custom Lord Winklebottom playing cards! Each suit will feature custom character designs specifically created for this exclusive deck. Be the envy of your friends next game night with the classiest deck of cards to ever grace the table!
Have your favourite animal, pet or yourself as an animal in-game as a non-playable character, to be featured in a book, newspaper or portrait that you can find while exploring the game world! You also have the chance to name your character! (as long as it is not offensive and fits in with the theming of the game).   
By backing one of our higher tiers you will receive a special mention in the game credits to show our heartfelt appreciation!
A personalised portrait of your favourite animal, pet or yourself as an animal in the style of the game. You will also receive a special signed A5 print of your portrait for you to frame and have take pride of place in your home! 
The ultimate reward! Have your favourite animal, pet or yourself as an animal as a suspect! Lord Winklebottom will be able to interrogate them and they will feature as a major character! You also have the chance to name your character! (as long as it is not offensive and fits in with the theming of the game).  
 
          Reward Tier Breakdown
  Some of our rewards are now available as add-ons! If you would like to get your hands on one of these items you can do so by selecting "Manage your pledge" after backing and adding on the amount listed above. A survey will be sent out to backers after the campaign has ended for you to let me know which add-ons you want. 
The development cycle for the full game will be around 14 months. I already have a lot of the initial work done, in order to make the prototype demo that you can check out at the top of this page. There’s a lot of content needed to go from that to a full size adventure game, however.
The core of the game is its puzzles, so the development process will focus on these first. The plan is to rough out or wireframe the entire game - every location, character and puzzle - to produce a complete playable version of the finished product, but without final art or dialogue. This allows for quick iteration and testing of the puzzles. Once I’m completely happy with this, work will begin on production quality art, and making finishing touches to the final script ready for voice recording.
I have outlined some key dates below, followed by a pie chart with a revenue split so you can get an idea on where the money is going.
  After many years working at large companies on AAA titles I have always had a burning passion to work on my own game and have more creative input, which has now lead to me becoming a solo developer working from my home office setup. So far, Lord Winklebottom Investigates has been completely self-funded and developed entirely by me and I’ve dedicated a lot of my own time to the project. To make the game really live up to its promise, and be as amazing as I want it to be, though, I’ll need some extra help, and that's where you come in!
It’s really important to me to have the game fully voice acted to a high standard, so part of the money from the Kickstarter will go towards this - actors and studios aren’t cheap, especially for the amount of dialogue in a full-size adventure game. The game really comes alive when the characters have voices, so this is something I’m really keen to get right.
As well as recording the dialogue, it also needs translating, so that Lord Winklebottom’s adventures can be enjoyed around the world. While I can't promise specific languages (other than English) at this point, I’ve been in touch with a few localization companies already in order to work out costs. Translating the large amount of dialogue you find in an adventure game isn't cheap, so this is something that would be impossible without Kickstarter.
I am planning on collaborating with a composer to create a unique, 1920’s inspired soundtrack to really bring the game world to life and make it feel a truly immersive and authentic experience.
I’ll also need a bit of help with programming - in particular porting to Switch and making sure all the usual Steam goodies, like achievements, are integrated into the game.
Finally, of course, there’s QA. I’d like to get some of the backers involved in testing the game during development to get feedback and help tweak puzzles, but we’ll also need full QA to make sure there are no nasty bugs in the finished game.
All of this of course costs money. This is where you come into the equation and can help build and be a part of the game as a valued contributor!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A big chunk of the game has already been developed to keep risks at a minimum and I am really close to turning my vision into a reality. 

I have over a decade of experience and am used to running projects, budgets and sticking to tight deadlines. I am very confident about Lord Winklebottom Investigates and with your support we can together create the best game experience possible. I will post updates as much as possible and share exclusive information with all backers first. 

I am excited and can’t wait to see the game fully come alive with beautiful 1920’s music and professional voice overs, all thanks to your support!

campaign.story:
The Fuzzy Princess is an ongoing comic about a cat princess who must embrace humanity after getting lost on her travels. 
I'm Charles Brubaker, writing in from the royal kitty castle! I've been drawing "The Fuzzy Princess" since 2016, and since then have drawn and colored over 400 pages!
I had two paperback volumes of “Fuzzy” printed, but due to limited resources they were released in black and white. I always dreamed of having it put out in color, however, and made it my goal to do so.
This is where this Kickstarter come in, to reprint the first book volume in color. It's not just a color version of the black and white books, I'm also adding new materials: title-page illustrations for each chapter, behind-the-scene sketches, as well as remastering old comic pages, with cleaned-up art and dialogue for clarity and general improvement.
The book will be in 6x9" paperback, 192 pages long, collecting the first 13 months of the webcomic (October 17, 2016 to November 17, 2017).
REWARDS
I'm offering a variety of rewards: the book itself, original art, stickers, prints, and more! Here's a handy chart showcasing what I offer (each additional rewards are highlighted for easy reading)
EDIT (2-17): 100% backed!
Thank you all who backed my project! Means a lot that I received so many support.
At this stage, stretch goals aren't too feasible, but here's one I can do. In the $40 tier and higher, I'm offering 4 stickers. If I reach $5,100, I will add a 5th sticker of Kuma and Chiro at no extra cost (EDIT 2-18: STRETCH GOAL MET! Backers who pledged the $40 tier or higher will be receiving this sticker!)
 If anyone wants this sticker, you can change your tier to the $40 tier or higher and receive this, along with all the other rewards in the set!

campaign.story:
Sol705 is a hilarious graphic adventure that brings back all the good stuff from the '90s point and click classics with a -slightly- modern touch! Because nostalgia is not what it used to be!
 Join a group of eccentric friends looking to sneak out from duty and spend all their free time at their own secret extraterrestrial research club.
Making contact with an alien race? Easy. Getting a date with one of their classmates, well… let just call it a top priority at the club's hidden agenda!
PLAY

Can’t wait to get your hands on this game? Good news: there’s a demo waiting for you! An introductory chapter that offers about 60 minutes of full-voiced gameplay (subtitled up to 6 other languages) where you’ll get to take an amazing tour around some of what Sol705 has to offer.
                                                          The story will unfold during the 70’s, over the course of a young boy’s winter break in a remote town called Tucana Lake, located on a land at the very end of the world known as Argentina. Mystery and references around every corner, a distorted reality that mixes american, european and out of this world pop culture influences and lots of amazing wacky sci-fi situations has been set to provide you hours of pure pixelated ecstasy!
This game pays homage to the great Lucas Arts, Sierra and Delphine Software of yore, making use of the 4 classic interaction verbs: examine, talk, pick up and use. Speaking of verbs, I do believe that a good script is the one thing that can’t be out of this kind of games, so making you laugh, or at least chuckle, in delight with some clever one-liners, funny interactions and sassy comebacks is going to be one of my main goals.
Those are just a few of the wackiest Tucana inhabitants. Some of them are hidden in they houses or bunkers. Establish contact with them at your own risk!
Like the demo? Then get ready because, with your help, this game can become larger, bigger, and better, since there’s still room for improvement such as better animations, graphics, music and tons of super funny and intriguing new situations!
● More than 45 original characters!
● Up to 3 playable characters (human and no humans!)
● Dozens of beautiful hand made backgrounds scenarios!
● Full-voiced dialogues in english by a cast of professional voice actors!
● Amazing pop rock soundtrack performed by real life bands!
● Unique retro sci-fi ambience!
● Not so hard puzzles and retro cool stuff to collect and use!
● Out of this time cameos and conversations!
● DRM - Free download or Steam (pixel hunting free) Key!
● Dialogues and cutscenes translated into not only english but also spanish, german, russian, french, portuguese and (Probably? ) esperanto!
My name is Patricio Land aka Pato and I’ve been working on this game in all my free time for the past ten months as a personal project, sometimes even with my kids as a family project! Back in october 2017 the first episode of this story was released for free on a bunch of platforms. Since then, the response from the public was truly amazing. Adventurers loved the characters, the story, the music… it left me speechless! 
It made me really happy to see people asking me for more and more original content every day. It was a lot of hard work and I was expecting some success (not, really!) so I'm delighted with the community reaction! 
I'd love to be in touch, please can contact me at:
Facebook
Twitter
Good question! Thank you for asking!
First of all, with any rewards, no matter how much you pay, you will get the GAME Sol705 in FULL VERSION! 
No episodes, no to be continued cliffhangers, no chapter delivery, no hidden purchases. The FULL GAME as it's has to be!

The demo version  aka 'Exordium' covers only the 1 day of the adventure, and you will have 8 more days to discover the truth of Laguna Tucana. That's a lot of content, as you can see!
And now for the cool part:
This campaign came not without some sweet, sweet deals, such as making all versions of the game available for you, mighty backers!
All rewards give you access to developer's forums and diaries!
This includes all game versions to be available for you, mighty backers, months before public release including a 20% off discount price! 

For those who are curious, some extra information: the packaging is the classic old fashioned game cardboard box, in two pieces (front and back) measuring 23.5 by 5x18 by 5x4 cm (aprox).  So it will fit perfect into your collection, no worries! 
Keep in mind that the game is only available for digital download no matter which pledge you choose.
Nevertheless we're retro family and we can't really trust that online services will last forever, so if you have opted for a tier of $40.- or more 
there's an option: you can add a DVD version of SOL705 (full game, DRM Free as always) for only $15.- extra.
Also original hand made amigurumi figure of Bobina are now available! So hurry up, there's only a small quantity of them!
I'm sure most of you are familiar with those stuffed yarn creatures of japanese origin, but just in case, amigurumi is the art of make knitting or crocheting small dolls based upon anime characters or just cute animals.
 And I was lucky enough to be related with one of the most talented amigurumi creator around and she's eager to start knitting those crazy Bobinas for you. Don't be afraid, they won't bite as the real one! Even if you point them with your finger ;)
And for those who love the sweet smell of fresh ink in a glossy piece of paper, three amazing new features! A set of sticky stickers, a postcard of Laguna Tucana in all it's splendor and a gorgeous printed version of the soviet occupation of Tucana way before the Gorbachev era. Signed by me and the team, Mikhail was not in the mood, but still a beauty!
Everybody loves posters !
They are really gorgeous and I'm in love with them. The first one, the comic version, has been drawn a couple of years ago when Sol705 was still more a concept than a real thing. The second one, the anime version as I like to call it, has a lot of influence from one of my favorite japanese series: Genesis Climber Mospeda (aka Robotech the new generation). Can you spot the Lancer on it?
Both are fabulous posters with high quality paper and printing!
How to proceed?(Please keep in mind that add-ons are only available for tiers of $40.- or higher due to shipping costs).
Choose the add-on(s) from the list. Go to “manage your pledge” button on the top of this page. Increase your pledge by $15.- or $20.- depending on your item, and ”Save your pledge” without changing the Tier that you originally pledged at.
And after the campaign, we will contact you to ask about the add-on(s) you want and inform you about delivery dates.
And just to make things more interesting, I'll add a free digital copy on all tiers of this rare handbook written by Professor Romaniak during his Tucana days. A real gem. You welcome!

Fan of the classics point and click adventures aesthetic? Sol705 features good old 2D art and animation. There´s no 3D or Spine rig animation involved whatsoever, just hand-drawn pictures along with that beautiful myriad of animated pixels we love to see our characters move, which feels -and looks- just great!
Here you have a sneak peak of some background illustrations for
Tucana´s Lake, the little town where everything can be possible...
One of the funniest things in point and clicks is the possibility of use and combine all the stuff you’ll be picking up and carrying on along the journey, and this is not going to be the exception! Very much on the contrary, I am sure that many of the objects to be used in the game will bring incredible fond memories to some of you and will awake curiosity and disbelief in those who have never seen before...! Those are a few ones from the dozens you'll find around.
But what about the beats, you may wonder? The OST includes great songs from the south american under scene, which is one of the main themes of this adventure. Two tracks are composed by a personal favourite: the Hiroshima Dandys. Other bands are also working to bring us some amazing songs, going from techno pop to symphonic rock!
In addition I have three fantastic musicians providing both the main theme and the incidental music.. 
Other talented musicians who had collaborated with me are Eric Matyas, Chris Whickham and Christian Laszlo. 
And more great news: new bands are set for the next release, as NAX from my own cousin Nicolás Castello!
But anyways, back to the point: all these are some of the reasons why I need funds to bring this game to the next level. After proving the community and myself that I'm fully capable of this, my next step is to ask for some real bucks to be able to give everything I have to make everything I have planned for Sol705 a reality.
Graphic adventures are the best thing in the world but also pretty hard to make; there's a lot of stuff to do: illustrations to draw, animations to make, dialogues to write and translate into several languages, music to compose... not to mention programming and keep chasing nasty bugs during countless nights!
I’ve been working on this project for several months and I’ve finished around a 60% of the final adventure. Anyhow, I can cover for most of the game expenses. The KS donations are for extra things like translations (english is not my native language) animations and voice acting. My living costs are already covered and I work at home...well...actually on a cave not so far from it, so rest assure on that one!
I started programming as a hobby back in the '90s for the Sinclair Spectrum, Commodore 64 and Amiga 500. One of my early games was pirated even before finished...and I ended up buying it without knowing! Even though, those were really great times and with Sol705 I wanted to bring back those feelings of joy and madness after spending several years into game press journalism. 
That is why I'm developing this adventure, powered by two steaming coffee pots, running full time, under very dim lights and with tons of coding dumps surrounding me. But this time I'm not alone!
I decided to team-up with the same amazing artists, animators, translators, voice actors and musicians that worked with me in the demo (and some new others) to improve over the quality of this and take my ideas to the next level! And the best thing is that I don't need to make everything from scratch to get the game ready as I'm using a revolutionary Bladecoder engine by Rafael García that it's like a dream come true! 
On the artistic side I count with the talent of Himashis Karmakar an out of this world artist working on the backgrounds on double shift! Some of their art can be appreciated below, you'll love it!Translations will be are assured by the best professionals into the localisation arts: Christophe Pallarès @xtooph for the french version, Alexander Preymak  @preymak from the russian kosmonautic center, and Michael Stein @atneon at the german frontier. 
You can always be in touch with me at:

Facebook

Twitter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Like in any project, specially creative projects, some problems can arise throughout development and I'm truly aware of this. However I'm more than decided to bring this game to its final version, as exposed above.

The development of the first episode (or demo, however you like to call it) of Sol705 took hours and hours of hard work but, nevertheless, has been a pleasure, even during the hard moments.
I'm a super serious planner, hard worker and I'm very passionate about what I believe, and I do believe in providing you, mighty backer, the best product I can conceive.
Even if I get kidnapped by aliens -one never knows- I'm sure I'll be able to find some piece of hardware inside the ship to continue developing between all those nasty body tests. So rest assured, and thank again for your support!

updates.update_content: Hello everyone, I hope you are ok!
We are almost at the end of the year and I think it is important to update you on everything that has been going on in recent times and on the news about the game. Let's jump on it !

Hi guys, this is Pat again broadcasting from Tucana Lake on the frequency of 705 Khz!
I'm aware that I have been not posting news since a while but I have a good reason to justify this lack of communication during the last weeks and the good reason is that Sol705 has been selected by Pro Helvetia (the Swiss Art Council) as one of the only 3 games in production state to have they official support.
It has been a lot of extra work (paperwork, game pitchs, travels, extra detailed planifications, contracts, etc, etc) but it has been absolutely worth it, because our game has been chosen over more than fifty great projects (only 10 of these arrived to the finals) by a jury of experts on the field. This is truly and honor and i'd like to share it with all of you, amazing backers, because your contribution to this adventure was a solid argument to present to the (I also have to say) amazing jury.
