campaign.story:
AdventureX is a free event taking place in London on the 11-12th Nov 2017, bringing together developers & gamers with a passion for interactive storytelling.  
We love graphical adventures; interactive fiction; exploration games; visual novels – just about any game with a great story to tell. Since 2011 we've been inviting gamers and developers from across the globe to share their experiences and exhibit their games.
Stretch Goals
We hit our target within 24 hours! AdventureX 2017 is on. We've also ploughed through our stretch goals, and will actually be making a Big Papercraft Figurine. We do what we must because we can.
"What rewards do I get?"
This year, we've commissioned illustrator Simon Reid to create some unique, collectable mementos of AdventureX 2017. Pin-badges proved hugely popular in 2016, so they will be back with 6 new designs.
Badges are 25mm (1 inch) in diameter. All designs subject to change.
This year, we're creating adorable Papercraft Figurines with interchangeable heads - so you can assemble and re-assemble an infinite variety of characters!
OK, the variety of characters is not actually infinite.
You can also grab a Mystery Steam Key from one of the developers supporting this Kickstarter Campaign. It's a pot luck of narrative-driven indie splendour!
"Who will be speaking?"
We will be announcing guest speakers as soon as they are confirmed. So far we look forward to welcoming:
Jon Ingold (80 Days, Sorcery!)
Rolf Saxon (voice of Broken Sword's George Stobbart)
Dave Gilbert (The Blackwell Series)
Doug Cockle (voice of Geralt of Rivia, the Witcher Series)
More TBC...
(Speakers and schedule subject to change.)
Previous guest speakers include: 
Charles Cecil (Broken Sword, Beneath A Steel Sky)
Rhianna Pratchett (Tomb Raider) 
Emily Short (Galatea)
Steve Ince (The Witcher, So Blonde)
To find out more, check out the highlights of AdventureX 2016:
"Where does the money go?"
AdventureX is a not-for-profit event, and it's free to attend for both visitors and exhibitors. Our biggest overhead is the cost of venue hire, but we also need a budget for promotion, print media, Kickstarter rewards and to ensure the viability of the event in future years.
We build a small contingency to each section of the budget, to help us deal with the unexpected.
"Can I buy a ticket?"
Just like last year, the event is free and non-ticketed. However, for 2017 we are offering a limited edition Guest List reward. Select the Adventure Xtreme or Adventure Xquisite tier to get your name on the Guest List.
Backers on the Guest List will be guaranteed entry as long as they arrive before midday. We think this is the best way of keeping the event free, and making sure people who've travelled a long way don't end up disappointed.
Guest List T&Cs: The Guest List reward is non-transferrable. Backers on the Guest List must arrive before 12.00pm each day to be guaranteed entry. 
You don't have to get on the Guest List, you can just arrive early and join the queue. Even if the Guest List sells out, we have reserved spaces to allow people to turn up on the day. Another way to guarantee entry is to volunteer to help run the event.
If you would like to volunteer to help run the event, (welcoming visitors and speakers, running livestreams etc.) please complete the Volunteer Application Form.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With a live event like AdventureX, there are always risks. Speakers can pull out, travel can be disrupted, tech failures can scupper presentations.

We have many successful events under our belt, but it's important for us to insure ourselves against unexpected twists and to secure the future of the event. With our experience and your support, we're confident we can deliver another great AdventureX.

                 “Born of the romance between Ghost Goblins and Pang, living in worlds like Naruto and Hellboy” It would be how we define our game…
Savage: Road to Darkness is a 2D Adventure/platform game, which is heavily influenced by traditional animation combined with digital art, the challenges that came with retro games and our love for manga/anime.
"Abandon hope all ye who enter here" I remember very well this phrase written at the Gate of Hell of Dante Alighieri, this phrase for some reason always caught my attention, what a terrifying phrase at the entrance of such an overwhelming place. Anyone reading it would feel the same fear Dante felt about to enter hell, but it also made me wonder what would happen if someone about to enter this tragic place was worse than the Devil himself, and so it occurred to me to write Savage: Road to Darkness.
         Become Oni Wani, uncover the mystery about his past and turn into a merciless warrior in a merciless world. Let his Darkness consume you and survive using his violent instinct.
Akuma no Rakuen (Devil's Paradise) is a big continent, full of life and challenge, replete of beauty and danger. The whole area is connected and what lies beyond, in each part of Akuma no Rakuken, is unknown.
Once you decide to play this game you must leave all salvation behind you, and strive to survive and become stronger.
Welcome to the Darkness.
     The king has passed away and for ten years his kingdom, an incredible world finds itself sunk in an endless war due to the void left since the king's death has awaken many people's desire to take over the empty throne. Akuma no Rakuen has split off and a whole continent lays under the laws of some self-claimed kings, who with a great power and intellect, have accomplished to own a vast extension of territory in which everyone who crosses their path is forced to submit.
A legend lives in the shadows like a whisper that manifests itself as a myth among the faithfuls to the previous king... "The dragon will come and the fire will consume everything to make of paradise his kingdom".
    Ninjutsu:  An ancient lethal art that defines a ninja. It allows Oni Wani to use a variety of weapons and secret techniques, in order to transform himself into a living weapon.
Shinobigana (ninja sword): A deadly discipline that only few beings can master. Oni Wani can use any kind of ninjaken (ninja blades) with tremendous dexterity and precision, even the legendary Cursed One. Different types of ninjaken exists, each one with its own unique effects. So be prepared to improve your sword skills and become a master.
Chakra/Jutsu: Chakra is the energy of life, created from all livings things. Several forms of Chakra exist that affects the nature of the individual. By harnessing this energy special, powerful techniques can derived, known as Jutsus. Wani can bend the Chakra energy to his will, enabling him to switch between its different manifestations. Those who run out of Chakra will perish.
Shinobi Hidden: Special abilities that can be used for defense,deception, stealth and engage.Embracing these skills will make the Darkness your ally.
       The driving force of the story is a mysterious anthropomorphic being called Oni Wani.
He was given the name based upon his close resemblance of a crocodile (wani) and his demonic (oni) nature that brings chaos to any land he sets foot on. He was reborn from the Greater Tree of the lost continent, Akuma no Rakuen, with his memory wiped clean. Lost without memory, the emptiness he feels strongly tempts him with anger and violence.
With his beating heart, Wani forges a weapon created by his deep hatred. He will seek out new places and encounter strange creatures which will in turn, unravel his true existence.
Iwa no Senpū (岩の旋風)
  Mizu kurōn (水クローン)
  Shinobigatana (忍刀) - Taka no Kage (鷹の影)
    Doragonburesu (ドラゴンブレス)
  Tsubuyaki (つぶやき) - Shi no Mai (死の舞)
  Ten no Ryū (天の龍)
  Amaru Kingdom: The place where the origin of chaos for the civil war started. Uma The Protector from Amaru died, and with her the loyalty for the King. Now the beast's land have another leader so aggressive and ferocious, that blood cover this land. Anyone who challenge him will face his destructive force.
Tawā (タワー) - Hanabi (花火) - Hashiro (は白)
  Shuma (数码)
  Kurenai (紅)
   Blanka ( 白)
  Kinzoku (金属) - Awai Shi (淡い死)
  Watanabe (渡辺)
  Together we can release the seal that oppresses the other goals, as the power of Oni Wani increases through the campaign.
We can currently assure versions of the game for Pc, Mac and Linux.
For other consoles (Ps4, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch) should be expected to be confirmed each version and reach the respective goal in the campaign.
People who donate 15 € or more, will have access to them, although they will be available for everyone in the add ons list.
Wani himself will be notifying you of any changes that occur in the process of acquiring the game in these versions.
Our original take on Savage: Road to Darkness was that of an arcade style, intended for mobile devices. However, after months of development and careful planning the project has rapidly evolved, featuring an incredibly extended world, an exciting story, and expanded gameplay features.
Furthermore, this project makes use of high definition 2D art which is one of the most expensive forms of art. To produce a high quality visual result like that requires a lot of work, patience and time. Our general scope for the future is to establish Artcle Studio as a full game company, which means that we will have to deal with different forms of costs, like operational, licensing, and living costs.
Taking the above points under consideration, this game will require the help of the community in order to be able to reach its final form within a proper deadline. Savage: Road to Darkness will be the start of a great and long journey, a journey that will require constant Improving, testing and the feedback of a strong community.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Savage: Road to Darkness is the game that we've always dreamed of bringing to life. This passion drove us to undertake a lot of risks, including pushing back our Kickstarter campaign for several months in order to have something truly amazing in our hands. Hand-drawn, high quality art like this comes at a high price and requires the aid of some very talented people. But that didn't stop us investing time, money and energy so we could design the world of Akuma no Rakuen exactly as we have imagined it. 


We worked extensively for months into building a functional prototype so that you can have a better understanding of our game design, as well as our final vision. Most of the core mechanics and basic framework is in place, however, there is always room for improvement. We have carefully planned our development stages with deadlines to ensure the smooth production of this game. Art will be further polished and gameplay will be greatly expanded and enhanced since this is required to produce the gaming experience that we have envisioned. 

This is the labour of love that we've always wanted to create: A beautiful, challenging game with cool powers and awesome characters. We have a lot of work ahead of us, because like our protagonist Oni Wani, we are striving for complete mastery of our skills. It is important for us for this project succeeds, since this is just the beginning of Oni Wani's journey and we plan to turn his endeavour into a complete saga! We feel confident that with your support we will offer a unique experience, unlike any other so far. So please join us, and together, we will travel along the Road to Darkness.

campaign.story:
French traduction (<- clic droit de la souris + "ouvrir dans un nouvel onglet")
Born of a friendly contest on GameJolt, this game offers a very simple concept and gameplay, but with the challenge becoming increasingly arduous: you'll have to help the robot to find the exit of four successive labyrinths, against a challenging timescale , and face various enemies and obstacles put there with the express purpose of slowing it down or making it fail.
Some levels will only be ruled by the timer. Some others will add obstacles (like gluing/slowing puddle, moving walls, ...), or ennemies (like green energy ghosts, fire cannons, electric ball barriels, ...). The player will have to bring the robot to the blue PortalSphere, end of the level, using only arrow keys of the keyboard.
  Rich in graphics and dynamic music that boosts both energy and concentration, LabyX strives, above all, to discover, test and memorize the maze levels, carefully studied / handcrafted in order to offer subtle and complex traps.
LabyX is a company that recycles defective robots into a game of labyrinths. Buying problematic robots directly from the factory, they offer a low cost experience for people : remotely control their own robot in complex mazes. Until now, no one has managed to reach the exit of the last level, and rumors are going on about what will wait the one who'll succeed. As soon as the concept was released, anti-LabyX groups focused on the protection of these robots have emerged all over the world ...  
... But the experts assured that no robot had any consciousness, or sensory perception, and that Labyx could be compared to remote controlled car tournaments. Since then, LabyX has become a benchmark in entertainment, in which many players have embarked : Contest e-sport, Youtubers, Twitchers, ... everyone hopes to win the ultimate glory of being the first to cross the inaccessible exit with his little robot. Will it be you?
First of all, I'm a musician, a music composer and a music teacher. All I do in life is close to the music domain. When I've decided to create this game, the first thing was to imagine a world born from my music. A sort of interactive experience around the sounds. So every level of this game have been made - path, concept and aesthetic - from a music I've created previously. I listen a loop of the music during all the realisation of the level : every sound, rythmic, harmonic or timbral variation I've composed has thereby an impact on how I'll conceve each maze.
        As a music composer, I've already written some music for different projects. You can hear them on my My Soundcloud profile, or follow these Bandcamp links :
LabyX Pre-Order
"3" BlackCube
Triptique pianistique
Music for Independant Projects
Small Practice OST
Boinihi OST (soon)
LabyX is therefore a game that will enhance memory, reflexes, and aid stress management. If the end of the fourth level of the current pack is not reached, the player will have to resume at the beginning of the first level of the current pack to continue their adventure. Do not hope to finish this game quickly: although the levels are medium sized, this does not impact negatively upon the ability to ensure that they are sufficiently challenging.
  LabyX has been designed to play in window mode, like many simple games that can be easily be placed in the background (be warned though: the game will continue to be operational, the timer will not cease and the enemies will still be lurking), it is, however, possible to play in full screen if the player prefers. LabyX will be compatible with most of computer operating Windows (XP/Seven/10).
A demo of this game is available on GameJolt, to give you a taster of what awaits you. 
  This demo has no restrictions, except for the number of levels (16 in all, 4 packs of 4 levels). It is therefore possible for you to see / understand what LabyX has in store for you. The Kickstarter campaign provides for a game of over 60 different levels! And LabyX can develop further if a specific level of participation is reached (in this case LabyX could potentially go up to 100 levels or more!).
Games I've made/participated :  
"3" (Black Cube) (everything)  
Amertis (some graphics)  
Small Pratice (everything)  
Boïnihi (music)
Wonderful tools for which I have acquired the appropriate official licenses: 
Graphic : 
Vue Complete
Groboto V3 
Poser Pro 
Music : 
Music Creator Touch
EWQLSO sound bank 
Z3ta +2 
Programmation : 
Fusion 2.5 Dev
   A new star is born : the steps
Groboto Modelisation
  Vue Complete Texturing
  Poser Rigging/Animation
           3 000 €: the game is funded (60 levels) 
6 000 €: addition of several tens of levels and additional music 
10 000 €: addition of a story, animations / cinematics
          PLAY

  Zeus : by Jupiter, this game enlights me ! 
Bender : hey GBT.X ! Wanna kill all humans?
Jesus : arise and buy it
Albert Einstein : E=LabyX²
Galileo Galilei : and yet it worth it 
Isaac Newton : what goes in must come out
Gandalf : buy, you fools !
Yazorius : If I wasn't the creator of this game, I would like to be him so bad !
I've already started to work on the next pack of levels, on its design of new obstacles, the aesthetics of the corridors, the labyrinths and the general atmosphere. Soon, the new pack will be finished, and I'll publish the news both on Kickstarter,Gamejolt and IndieBD (some news will be exclusive here on Kickstarter, as a reward to the backers of this project). The backers who have chosen a reward including the beta /test versions will be able to play/test the first level of each new pack as soon as it is ready/playable.
LabyX in its demo version (functional engine, 16 levels, management of backups, ...) took me a big month of hard work. Let this be the assurance that I am able to lead this project to its conclusion, without disappointing any potential backers with setbacks. I will be available directly on Kickstarter, and commit to answer questions and comments, whilst also regularly bringing news about the project’s development progress.  
Whilst I will be combining the creation of this game with my job as a music teacher, as soon as the Kickstarter campaign is launched, I shall remain in daily communication with the backers and will maintain this direct link between the myself and the backers throughout the creation of LabyX . Having supported many Kickstarter campaigns, I know that sometimes very little information is given to the backers and so I am all too aware of which pitfalls to avoid. You can count on my regular presence here, as well as complete transparency around LabyX.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk factor for the project is that it is entirely designed, managed, conducted and realized by only one person: me. The project of a single man may not inspire confidence, but all of the collaborative projects that I have wanted to participate in have not come to fruition, despite my absolute energy, motivation and commitment. Ultimately, I do not doubt that this energy, will and motivation will be the key to the success of LabyX.

2017 est fini. 2018 prend sa place.
Que cette nouvelle année vous apporte à toutes et tous bonheur, santé et prospérité.

My new engine is validated (by me) !

All the levels already created will be updated on my new operating engine. So stay tuned if you want to try them implemented in a full demo like the old official one. I’ll change few little things.

At the end, all the 16 levels will be available in this 16/9 screen mode, with full collision and layers system. With this, GBT.X will have more company in the mazes, and the design will be free of a lot of technic restriction I had before …

Hi everybody !  
According to some critics avec advices, I've changed few things in LabyX, and brought them to the first level of LabyX. It's not a demo, only a different version of the engine I've made.
And I would like to have your opinion : wich version do you prefer ? The first or this new one ?

campaign.story:
What is Rogue Raiders Online?
Rogue Raiders Online is a sci-fi Action RPG game with strong emphasis on exploration and cooperative multiplayer.
Players will create their own character and venture alone or in up to a four raiders team exploring worlds, getting jobs done.
Main features:
Single player and offline modes also included!
Real-time hack and slash combat.
Online cooperative multiplayer.
PlayStation TV support.
Why PS Vita exclusive?
This game pretends to be a final love letter to our most beloved game handheld, the PS Vita.
Right now a lot of games are cancelling their Vita port, there's no first party support... I think this console still has a lot to say and this game will be proof of that.
This game is designed from the ground up and optimized for the PS Vita, in order to deliver the best experience.
The Game
The main idea of the game is a co-op experience in a hostile environment. So it's not going to be the standard "lets be friends" approach but more of a "we need to cooperate in order to survive". You're not a knight in shining armor but rather a rogue with his own agenda.
In Rogue Raiders Online, there is no galaxy to save but a rent to pay.
You start creating and customizing your own raider, choosing between several alien races and classes, each one with unique stats and traits that may dramatically affect your gameplay.
Then you will be sent to a near space station which serves as a central hub for players to find each other, purchase better equipment, sell valuables, etc.
There will be job boards, which list available quests for you or your team. After assembling a crew, you will travel to a planet to do the job.
Planets will be handmade, no procedural or random planets that end up looking all up the same.
Like any other RPG, Rogue Raiders is filled with quests or jobs for you and your team to do.
The jobs you can get will vary depending on your raider cred, your reputation with the three main factions, among other things.
They are varied and can involve tasks like traveling to a spaceship crash site in order to find survivors, scavenge the remaining gear, doing planetary cartography, steal trade secrets for a rival faction, etc.
These jobs are a collaborative effort, although sometimes one of your crew can have a secret "rogue objective" than can jeopardize the current mission, so you never know up to what point you can trust the others.
After all you are all rogues so what can you expect!
The game will feature a singleplayer offline mode too, so you can go and explore on your own, hunt creatures, or maybe find a nice robot, hack it to later resell it and earn some credits.
Each world has its own biome, dungeons, puzzles, enemies and treasures. The events in them will constantly change, so they will be living worlds with constant activity.
My main inspiration for the visual design of the galaxy and worlds is the sci-fi art from the 60s and the 70s. I want each planet to have a unique set of colors, and to provide an eerie feeling to the players.
I've worked in creating a color palette with enough personality and contrast, that will help to differentiate and make interesting each planet and new area that you explore.
About Me
I've been working in the games industry as a programmer and designer for more than 10 years now.
My last released games includes various titles for PlayStation Vita, and I have worked on plenty of online multiplayer games, creating the network code for multiple platforms, so I have a deep knowledge about the console and network design and optimization.
Some of the previous games I've worked are "Phineas and Ferb: Day of Doofenshmirtz", "Muppets Movie Adventures" and "Young Justice Legacy".
I, for once, want to create something personal. This game is being made by just me, an one woman army. That's why I'm calling the studio "Dangerous Alone" :-)
Soundtrack
You can already check some of the music I composed for Rogue Raiders in SoundCloud:
How will the Kickstarter money be used?
Developing a video game cost a lot of money. For a PS Vita title, I will need to pay for some devkits (I need multiple to debug multiplayer), the rating systems like PEGI cost money even for indies, a lot of the money will go away in paying taxes, and of course Kickstarter takes the 5%.
The rest of the money will be used to pay for the extra work I can't get done, specially art (3d models, animations, etc). I have tried to set a really low budget, so unless the stretch goals are hit, most of the work will still depend on me.
Why should I support this game?
This is a personal project, and I know I'm competing against big publishers with large budgets, Hollywood actors, hundreds of hours of cutscenes and lots of in-game content.
I need to be smart and aim to the things those publishers aren't giving to the current players.
They rely in their big budget to create hundreds of mini games, side quests, etc. Thinking that if they give the player a lot to do they will end liking the game.
I'm doing the opposite, I'm creating a game based on the philosophy of people like Shigeru Miyamoto or Gunpei Yokoi, creating a simple core gameplay that is fun by its own.
With money, you can put a lot of fancy stuff that makes people forget about the foundation. But if the core of your game is good, that's what really matters.
So if you want a simple, yet fun and challenging experience, Rogue Raiders Online is your game.
Stretch Goals
 Follow us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being small, I need to be realistic. Content wise, this game will be closer to a NES game than a current Rockstar/Bethesda triple A, open world game. Nobody has ever told me that Zelda, Faxanadu or Battle of Olympus were too short, so I don't think that adding lots of features makes for a better game. I think that creating a fun core gameplay is what really matters.

The online part is an added difficulty, and requires lots of work in QA (beta testing), for that part, since this is a exclusive title, I will negotiate a publishing deal with Sony that warrants me QA from them. Worst case scenario, I will use part of the budget to pay a professional testing company. I want to release a good game.

Creating a video game is always a challenge, and previous experience developing and releasing games is key to success.

I've been working in the games industry as a programmer and designer for more than 10 years now.

My last released games includes various titles for PlayStation Vita, and I have worked on plenty of online multiplayer games, creating the network code for multiple platforms, so I have a deep knowledge about the console and network design and optimization.

I'm confident that I'm up to the task, since I have successfully released similar games in the past.

Backers will have full access to the private forums, development log and project status, with each milestone detailed and info about each current task in progress.

updates.update_userinfo: Some bad news... and some good news!
updates.update_content:
Hi fellow Raiders!
Sadly, the Kickstarter didn't reach its goal, so I'm back to square one.
I'm sad, I know that Rogue Raiders would have been a great game in PS Vita, but I have failed in translating my ambition and vision to the Vita community.
So what does this mean?

Hi, fellow Raiders!
Latest issue of the PS Vita magazine, the Vitamag, is out now and it's FREE to read:
http://en.calameo.com/read/0042561428ac3dee6493e
You will find a nice interview about Rogue Raiders Online inside.

Hi, fellow Raiders!
I'm proud to announce that Eduardo De La Iglesia will be producing original music for the game. That not only will help me to focus on game design and programming tasks, but to upgrade the score of Rogue Raiders Online to greater standards.

campaign.story:
Asylopole is a satirical old-school adventure game set in a dystopian future.
You play the role of Adam Murdock, a psychiatrist working in a gigantic asylum. Get inside your patients’ heads to find out what’s gone wrong. Experience totally new universes and fight your patients’ worst nightmares...
This is basically a one-man project, with a few commissions.
The game will be DRM-free too !
Classic style Adventure with alternative gameplay elements
Great story and large universe
Non-linear
2D hand drawn graphics, rotoscoping, stop-motion
Varied gameplay: exploration, puzzles, fights,...
Adjustable difficulty
Controllers support
Leveling system
Eat nice Fastbouf burgers ( look at that sauce dripping down ! )
The game takes place in a post apocalyptic future where it’s a daily struggle for the population just to stay sane.
Under the huge dome that covers the megalopolis and all its inhabitants, you play the role of Adam Murdock, a psychiatrist working in an insane asylum, a gigantic building that supports the center of the dome.
 When treating patients, you are able to access their inner most thoughts and help fight the phobias and other mental problems that exist in a virtual world that’s known as Mentalis.
 Each "universe" has a new gameplay with some puzzles, a unique visual (draw, stop-motion / clay animation sequences,...) and a boss to defeat.
 And, as if that wasn't enough, you have to deal with "The Order", which controls the megalopolis and Ratpunks, a group of punks who are against "The Order" ...
The game feels like a 90s adventure, with nice features, colourful world, mature themes, humour and strange characters. Explore the megalopolis, the asylum and various locations, and complete quests.
You are able to interact with almost anything in the world, grab and use items, solve puzzles and speak with characters (your answers may affect your relationship with your partner).
 Many activities are available ! If you want, you can play mini-games, visit some shops and restaurants (Fastbouf), send messages, surf the "Ultranet" and even read many comments on the social network "Lookme".
The game will be available in English and French. Other languages may be possible depending on the amount raised through the campaign.
Work-in-progress gameplay footage (music by Vinsfeld):
PLAY

Music:
Undersea:
Lost in the city:
Mickaël Pixoala, developer
My name is Mickaël and I love video games, especially old adventure games. I started programming little games for my own family, 15 years ago. Few years later, I wrote the word "Asylopole" on a paper and the story begins ! On this project, I've been doing almost everything (story, writing dialogs, art, music,...).
Funding and support: You !
Also, thanks to these fine folks:
 Dante Comstock, voice over (Adam Murdock, AI)
"I'm a 50/50 man in several hundred ways other than keeping things 50/50. I could be the life of the party or I could be keep'n it cool & be laid back as Hell. At the end of the day, I try to make sure you can't live with me & can't without me."
Xss, voice over (Old guy, clown)
Youtuber in his spare time: let's play (video gaming), some movie critics and voice over. Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/0Xss0fr
Zeus81, help for scripting
Special Thanks to my friends and family who continuously support me.
Asylopole is a love letter to old school adventures games, Kubrick, Blade runner, and many others as you can see:
Asylopole is a passion project, worked in any spare time I can find. The project is ambitious in its scope. To do justice to what I have planned will require time and funding.
Your support will allow me to dedicate myself fully to making the game.
There are also elements which require other people's expertise: Translations and voice acting. Other costs such as licensing, your fabulous rewards, kickstarters fees contribute to the overall budget.
You can also help us in another way by sharing this Kickstarter: twitter, facebook, in the street with a megaphone... it's very important!
Depending on the success of the campaign, we will start revealing them as soon as we approach our initial goal...
Here’s some of the things you can get from us exclusively on this Kickstarter campaign. This is awesome dude ! Nice T-shirts, signed boxes, the chance to become a main character from just your name in the game, and so much more. Tiers with physical stuff include the worldwide shipping price. Some visuals:

What platforms will be supported ?
PC Windows. However, we will make a lot of efforts to have the game available on as many platforms as people will want it on, in the future (Linux and Mac OSX).
Will Asylopole be on Steam?
Yes (the game has been greenlit by the community).
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=777347943
DRM-free version ?
Yeah ! We want to give everyone the option between Steam and a DRM-free version.
Is there a press kit ?
Yes ! https://sites.google.com/site/asylopole/press-kit
Why Fastbouf burger isn't a physical reward ?
Because the flies can't survive during the shipping.

Risks and challenges
I've already spent most of my spare time into developing Asylopole. The story, a lot of the graphics assets and musics are already done for the game. But game development is complex, expensive and takes time; problems can arise throughout development.

However Asylopole is a project that I'm highly invested in on a personal level. With your support, I can polish and complete the project and provide you the great game you deserve.

I will send you regular updates, so that you feel you're part of the team.

campaign.story:
UPDATE: Kewpie-Jazzy is now accepting payments via PayPal! Thanks for your support.
Kewpie - Jazzy is a new 3D platformer inspired by the games of the golden era of the genre such as: Banjo Kazooie, Donkey Kong 64, Super Mario 64, etc...
Kewpie is a cat that loves adventures. Jazzy is a Pirate Parrot always searching for treasure. Together they are the perfect treasure hunting duo! Inspired by the fuzzy and colorful characters of Banjo-Kazooie, Kewpie and Jazzy are here to take you on a new adventure full of exploration in gorgeous 3D worlds, with items to collect, puzzles to solve and lots of fun in-between! With our dream soundtrack, you'll be immersed in a fun and beautiful universe!
Each character has their own unique special abilities. Kewpie can run really fast with her four legs and grab branches with her tail, while Jazzy can fly, glide, or help Kewpie jump higher! With their abilities combined they can reach all-new heights! 
Kewpie and Jazzy looking for treasures
        The Duo Protagonists: Our treasure hunting duo were designed to bring the most fun and satisfying experience platforming experience ever! We accomplish this through keeping the spirit of the old 3D platformers while adding new moves, abilities, and playable friends for Kewpie.
Fan Art Made by ScottyTheArtist
Multiple combinations: Throughout your adventure, you'll find numerous friends to help you overcome obstacles. For instance, why not swap out Jazzy and take an octopus with you? Poptopus has unique abilities of its own, like shooting ink and helping Kewpie to swim faster! This is just one of the many friends that Kewpie will find throughout the game.
  Poptopus is one of the many characters that will help you
                                          Kewpie with Poptopus underwater
DJembe the meerkat. He is really funny and a loyal friend.
                                Gameplay with DJembe in Dazel world.
DJembe the meerkat will help you to explore all kind of hidden holes!
  Let's ride!
  Jazzy is mad at Kewpie for swapping him out.
Collect Them All: Inspired by the great "collect-a-thon" era of gaming, there are hundreds of Gold Coins, Gold Ingots, and much more to collect in each world. Take on the challenge of exploring all of the secrets and completing all of the tasks to fully complete each world! Use your Gold to open new areas in the hub world! No worries, though - it's not necessary to find all the items to go to next area.
Tons of gold to collect
Side-Missions, New Outfits And Fur Spray: In each world, you'll find a variety of characters that will give you tasks for a reward, usually new clothes for Kewpie or fur spray to change her fur color. Complete all the tasks and fill your closet with all sorts of new accessories to use whenever you want!
  Kewpie wearing a black outfit in Mad Maze Hill world.
  Jazzy is afraid of ghosts
  Look behind you!
 A Huge Cast Of Characters: More than 20 secondary characters inspired by the classics that will (probably) help you. Side-quests, races, battles, football and many more fun activities await you in each world!
Conquer The World: Complete all the challenges, collect all the items and defeat the boss in each world to conquer it and save the land from the evil Conjurer Captain Cutlass. After you conquer a world, flags of Kewpie-Jazzy will appear all over it, showing everyone who rules that world.
Film Quality Graphics: Unreal Engine 4 provides us with the best tools to make you feel like you're inside a big-budget animated feature. Our team is always working to improve and add new details to the worlds to make them feel even more alive.
  Kewpie gliding with Jazzy in Dazel Valley world.
  There will be more than 10 worlds in Kewpie-Jazzy. Each one contains challenges you can complete to collect Gold Ingots, the main currency in the game. Use them and Gold Coins to unlock new worlds and open new areas of the hub-world!
Concept art of Dazel Valley world.
Each world contains ten Gold Ingots and one-hundred Gold Coins, plus side-missions! You don't need to complete everything to go to the next world, but if you do collect and complete everything, you will conquer the world! Flags of Kewpie and Jazzy will be placed all over the stage. How stylish! And it'll even help you to get to final world faster!
  If our initial Kickstarter funding goal is reached, backers can be assured that the Dokycamp team will deliver a complete, polished and really fun game for PC. The Windows version will launch day one with the Linux and Mac versions following shortly. However, our dream is to launch the game on all platforms at the same time. But, in order to accomplish such a huge task on time, we need to hire more professionals, and that means additional resources are required. That's why we have a list of additional extras that we'd love to deliver, in order to have enough resources and make Kewpie-Jazzy an even better game.
If sufficiently funded, Kewpie-Jazzy will be released for Windows, Mac, Linux, Xbox One and PlayStation 4 day one of release.
Any extra money will go towards improving the game. If we exceed our goal we'll be able to make the following additions: 
      ·Special thanks in the Kewpie-Jazzy credits!

updates.update_content: Hey everyone, thank you for your support! Time's running low with less than 48 hours remaining on our campaign! It might have a last minute catch which boosts it, and whom ever you can share this game with, please do! However, if we don't succeed, we want to let you know we'll be back in action soon and with more oomph prior to relaunch! We've met many awesome people who love classic 3D games and we're so grateful for the positive response to Griff, despite the difficulty we had exposing it. We had arranged to be on several huge sites, but might not pull it off prior to the campaign ending (that's okay because we'll still be promoting). It was a challenge to find that when sharing our game, people are uncomfortable with self promotion because it feels like advertising. This game is kind of an event in a sense, and so we want to share in the culture with the tribute that is Griff. From October onward we'll continue to expose and share, because there's plenty of support for this game, just not enough people who know about it!

Voice actor Griffin Puatu, performing Griff is just awesome, I love the confident protagonist Ratchet-like performance. Likewise, I'm very excited about how Aimee Smith is playing the wickedly cool Phantom Cat, Mia. Knocked my socks off with that Aussie accent. Next up I believe we'll have some lines from the talented Brittany Lauda and Steven Kelly for you to listen to. Some voices may change slightly as we develop the characters more, but this gives a nice idea. Thanks for your support!  
Gavin the Griffin and Griff the Winged Lion

Hey everyone, we'll be on Kotaku and Gamespot soon as well as on a couple other big sites. By the way, sorry for the slow kick off, we're working hastily to arrange some strong exposure. Please show your support in any way you can by sharing Griff around online with friends. Thanks so much!
Good News! We're excited to announce that in the works for Griff are some cool locations where you can try your hand at some epic snowboarding! Fly off snowy ramps for major air, do spin tricks and grind across winding bars of ice! We're adding a point system as well (will keep you posted)!

campaign.story:
Hello, and welcome to our Kickstarter campaign! Please take a look around to know more about Never Look Back and how you can help! Thank you so much for your time!
   
Quotes
  First of all, we are offering you to personaly explore Never Look Back by playing the fully-functioning demo version of the game. You can download it by pressing the button below.
  Okay, let's get started!
  Never Look Back is an adventure horror game with a heavy focus on story and exploration which is set for release in 2017 on Windows, Mac and Linux platforms.
The gameplay experience is a mix of adventure and psychedelic horror, which allows you to live through the Mark's eyes and help him to face his demons. 
Inspect every detail on carefully designed levels, use your deduction, solve puzzles to move forward and to get a feel for the horror atmosphere.
And for heaven's sake... never look back.
Relax Mark, everything is fine.
  As game designers we get inspired by authors such as Stephen King, Bram Stoker, H. P. Lovecraft and games like The Legend of Kyrandia, Clock Tower, Resident Evil, Penumbra, Amnesia, P.T. and Layers of Fear.
  Hand-painted retro-style pixel graphics combined with rich visual effects to achieve the highest level of immersion.
Classic adventure gameplay full of clever puzzles, hidden secrets and important choices, which lead you up at least to 3 different endings.
    I think I figured it out...
Detailed and fully interactive environment.
Story-focused exploration – only through exploring the environment you can shed some light on Mark's story, full of drama and mystery.
In addition to the main story, you will be able to find items, which uncover some horryfying facts about mansion and it's owners.
Сomplete with a tense atmosphere which won't let you go until the end.
Lamp will be your only guide in the darkness.
A chain of Mark's flashbacks to complete the plot development.
Full English voice acting.
A lot of references to your favourite games, books and films.
  Something weird is happening with Mark Walters - an unknown 23 year old writer from Salford, Manchester.
Mark's appartment. Locations like this will bring variety...
For two weeks he is chased by the same nightmare. He is running in circles for hours without the slightest possibility of escape. One day as he is leaving his appartment he wakes up in an abandoned mansion, full of mysteries.
Along with Mark you will have to explore the darkest corners of the mansion. Be ready to help the main character unveil what really is going on in this forsaken place, because the answer to that might not be so simple as it might seem.
... but remember - evil never sleeps.
    Since we are big fans of point&click games, we decided to use classical mechanics of the genre for the core of our game. Along with our vision, they create unique mechanics of Never Look Back. Our goal in terms of gameplay is quiet simple - create a game where even the slightest details of each mechanic recieve a lot of attention and time.
Throughout the journey you will have to overcome many obstacles, by solving all sorts of puzzles and riddles.
You should also be ready to face the horrifying and very unfriendly residents of the mansion, who will be doing their best to stop you from going further. 
You will have to run and hide. Wait for the opportunity to outsmart them. Remember - retreat is not an act of cowardice but rather a key to survival.
So what exactly do you need to do? The answer is simple - everything that you can. In Never Look Back you should be very attentive to details, in certain locations you have to be VERY attentive. We, in turn, will be doing everything we can to ensure that puzzles and riddles are logical. 
All of the gameplay is based on the interaction between the player and the enviroment. You will have an inventory at your disposal, in which you will be collecting all the nessessary items,
personal diary, where Mark will be writing his own comments about the events happening in game, and also a lamp, your only bastion of light in the neverending darkness of the mansion…
  What makes our game special, is that in unlike traditional point&click games, the player can move around using two keys:
We used this system in order to convey the tactile feeling of the character to the fullest, which is extremely important for the atmosphere of the game and our vision of the player experience.
In Never Look Back, the cursor will change depending on the action, which you decide to do with the object.
Inspect cursor - you will be able to take a closer look at the object and also hear Mark's thoughts about it.
Interact cursor - you can activate the object (lever, button, lamp, etc.) and see what happens.
Take cursor - pick up an important (or not) inventory item.
Move cursor - navigate from one location to another through doors.
Item cursor - when choosing an object from the inventory, cursor takes the form of the item. When clicking on any object with thus cursor, the item, if it's possible, will be applied.
Lot's of important objects are hidden from your eyes in boxes and drawers. This unique mechanic eases the access to what they contain. 


  Another helpful mechanic is the inspection mode, which allows you to take a closer look at the object and see the details which you didn't at first.
... the wine stain for example.
As you see, all the design solutions in the product support the following goals: develop a quality story-driven adventure game.
  We spent a lot of time trying to choose the most fitting music for this atmosphere. The unbelievable and amazing Kevin Macleod helped us with that. His compositions perfectly convey the sense of alarm and horror, which is nessesary for our genre. His great works were used in games such as: The Stanley Parable, SCP - Containment Breach, Kerbal Space Program, The Bridge, Robocraft and many more.
Legend.
    Don't Panic Arts is a small indie game development team, fully composed of students. We were all brought together by your dream - making video games. In all of our hearts they have a special place.
Our team has only one simple goal - to show the world, that in order to make quality games you don’t need a large game development company. The most important part - is what’s inside. The thing which makes you play the game over and over again. The soul of the game.
Never Look Back is about 40% complete.
We've already implement most of the game mechanics, designed locations and finished our story pipeline. The next steps are as follows:
- finish writing dialogues and voice over them;
- create the remaining world art;
- work more on the atmosphere, music, sounds and cutscenes;
- polish animations and gameplay.
We are aiming to be complete the project by late 2016 - early 2017. 
  Kickstarter has played an important role in the indie game development community for a long time now. Thanks to it, a lot of exciting projects have been launched that never could have been possible otherwise.
We've been working full-time for a few month now, but to continue working full-time on this project we need a little financial support. We're putting everything we can into this project every single day and we're asking you to trust us when we say: Never Look Back will be an amazing story-driven adventure. The money, feedback and support you invest in it will be worth it!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Game development was never an easy task - it's always a difficult and complicated process. Anytime there is a chance that some sorts of problems will pop up, but we are highly motivated, we are ready to face them, because bringing this project to life is our dream.

We're currently in the midst of the Never Look Back development. Unity 5 is one of the most exciting tools in tech right now and it has never been easier to bring the game ideas to life. The only risk we forecast is a possible slight delay in the game release date, since it may take a bit more time to polish our product to the perfect condition.

campaign.story:
imprint-X is a causal puzzle game for desktop and mobile, containing 100 uniquely crafted puzzles to solve where you hack and click your way to defeat the mysterious robotic Wardens. 
  The awakening
One day an AI woke up on an Asteroid Base. It sent out swarms of Nano Bots that attacked the people of the base, flew into their world and infected them with just a glance, planting Wardens in their minds. A robotic virus raged!
You've been sent so save the Asteroid Base!
The clone
The Wardens enslave the people! You are one of the hacker clones, saving people by hacking into their brains and defeating Wardens.
The startscreen
   It starts with a button!
Button based puzzles
At the release the game will include 5 people to save. Their brains are enslaved by a robotic virus.
Every brain is infected with about 15-20 Wardens each. Every Warden is a level with a button puzzle for the player to unlock. 
A brain is one world.
A brain infected with Wardens
 Zooming in...
To defeat a Warden the player has to click the Warden's buttons in the correct sequence. Clicking uses function() calls. You only have a set amount of functions per level.
A Warden
The Wardens contains many different puzzle combinations including memory, timer, timing, forming patterns, matching and more. 
Because we love buttons
Some puzzles are easy and chill, and some are harder. We wanted to make a causal game that is fun to play. And we love pressing buttons! Hope you do too!
When you've managed to save one brain, the next world is unlocked with new Wardens. 
Bosses
Every brain will include 1 or more bosses to fight!  The boss gameplay resolves around timing a circle and a box. When they overlay the player has to click to unlock a pattern.
The 6th world will be a procedurally generated boss level, with endless boss fighting!
Unlock next world
To unlock the next world the player needs to beat the world boss. The boss is unlocked when the player has gathered X points. Every Warden defeated gives 0-3 points depending on how many function() calls the player has used. Every Warden is re-playable, meaning that the player can get a better score if playing again.

The game got greenlit a couple of months ago, so imprint-X is also coming to Steam!
We're aiming to release imprint-X pretty soon, probably this autumn! 
We've gotten quite far with the development and worked on the game since december 2015 and now got an alpha ready!
The first level prototype we ever made for imprint-X back in December.
  We're developing the game in Unity and for now we have around 50 levels, most of the UI (as well as the options settings) is in place, the code structure is ready, we have an intro and most of the art, the 6h world with endless boss game-play is also almost finished. 
Building a level in unity!
  And now? We need to design more puzzle levels and polish the game as well as tweaking the boss gameplay, fixing bugs and some UI issues.
And the art style? Yeah, we love pixelart and imprint-X therefor is a 2D-game filled with super nice pixels!  We use a combination of pixelart, Lightening, shaders and gloom.
imprint-X will be released for mobile and desktop at the same time.
The couple Morgondag; Vendela Carlberg Larsson and Kim Aarnseth
Vendela and Kim
We met in Stockholm 2012 and fell in love. We were both creative people. We both painted and designed. Kim also coded stuff and have a long programmer background. Vendela on the other hand wrote poetry and worked on several theater projects.   
One day we decided to create something together so we merged our different skills; games came out from that. 
So, we began to make games, something neither of us had done before. We made many prototypes and minor games, our company Morgondag grew out from that and in 2013 we began to make our first bigger title; RymdResa. A game that we released on Steam in 2015.
Our current workplace

UPDATE: Since the creation of the video, the first 90% of the actual (interactive) game intro is available now on www.themindhero.com/intro -- check it out!  It's got some updates to the story not seen elsewhere here and gives a great idea of the quality of the visuals of these scenes.  Note: The link provided is only tested to work on computers. 
------
The Mind Hero is to be something completely new. In addition to being a puzzle/platform/dating sim in which you go into the minds of six girls and two adults to save them, you'll also learn important psychological concepts in the background of the story as you do, and these can be taken away from the game and applied to real life.
Colven, 17, visits the lab where his mother and grandfather work, knowing his mother has gone unconscious after taking an experimental antidepressant. As it turns out, it was actually suppressing negative feelings and making them more powerful, and in addition to putting her and the other six girls who took it into a coma, there is a side effect that Colven can enter their minds simply by laying near them and focusing.
 He enters the mind of his mother, who is torn with grief about-- among other things-- the effect the antidepressant had on the other six girls. So to help free her from grief, Colven must go into their minds first to save all of them, which can be done in any order. He'll learn important things about psychology, have some fun, meet some danger, and gain some affection along the way.
Some of the psychological concepts, as first presented by the late famous psychoanalyst Erik Erikson, are outlined within the video, while more will be presented within the game. You might be surprised after learning them all how they apply to you and those around you, and how helpful this knowledge might be to your life, even though the game will succeed as an immersively entertaining experience on its own.
The amount hoped for would finish making it possible, but anything extra would help to create content and to speed up the release as well. Thank you very much for your support of any size, feel free to send a message with any questions after having seen the video, and please spread the word.

Missed the Kickstarter? Keep Informed:
http://www.omnilinkgame.com/
Omni Link blends an epic visual novel story with real-time gameplay. The gameplay is also unique on it's own. You'll absorb and pilot ships with different abilities and can even use these ships as allies in a A.I controlled fleet for epic battles. You transform into them on the fly. It's awesome!
  You start the game as a man of little consequence. The first chapter: "A Hero Will Rise" defines exactly who you become.

An entity called "The Virus" awakes near the edge of the galaxy, and heads towards every star. As each star is consumed, people are discovering that this is a real threat. However, no one knows exactly what the Virus is, or has lived to tell about it.

On a routine mission for Zaos, you encounter an advanced warship. In the ensuing battle, both ships are destroyed and become bound together though a process called quantum entanglement.. The experience also binds you to an entity known as Ectype D-8. You quickly learn that there is more to this ship and A.I. that meets the eye.

The artificial intelligence is so advanced, she is able to absorb energy from other ships and duplicate them. As well as quantum burst, administer atmospheric regeneration, and of course...Omni Link.  You find out about these abilities as you play.

On your journey, you will meet dozens of interesting characters: Such as Dannon, a scientist claiming to be D-8's creator, Arcadia, a woman out of time with a dutiful mission as the last of her people.

Other characters such as a pirate boss who's identity is unknown, you're buddy Slicer, a wealthy gangster, and the Arena champion are people who will shape your story. You will earn a bounty, and be hunted by more then just the Virus.

Your choices in the game affect what happens to the story and gameplay in meaningful ways. What ships you acquire, who you save from the Virus threat, and what relationships of love, hate, and friendship you form. Who do you trust?
            FEATURES:
Real-time tactical combat
Choices that affect gameplay and story in minor and large ways
Huge two path end game split
Hand drawn character and background art
Epic emotional music
  WALLPAPER REWARD:
(donate $5 or more to receive) *sample size
SHIP DESIGN REWARD:
100's of ready made designs when choosing a look, or we can give you some pieces to make your own.

Then choose what standard weapon, ability, ship speed, armor, etc.. We'll leave it to your imagination, but don't go too crazy.
I uploaded the demo so I could be open to you with what I'm going for. The story comes off a bit quick and with errors at the moment, but this will be fixed with professional help. I "will not" release the game until the story is pristine. You'll also notice many backgrounds are missing, there will be many more in the game.
Thanks for understanding and have fun. More official updates every couple days.

Greg Rice from Double Fine : "The game is looking great, so congrats on all the hard work so far. Best of luck with everything though!"
 TODAY'S REVELATION : 
There will be a hidden postcard in each background ingame and you will have to find them all ! On them, the most beautiful PIN-UP of the galaxy from BeBoy Magazine !! And you'll find them physically with the tier rewards that proposed them !
"Sadly, I don't have a name yet... Backers who will have the permission to vote on our forum will have the choice to decide. Then prepare to be inspired please. I count on you human!"
You will die many times during your adventure, but it will not necessarily be a GAMEOVER... (???)
"I knew a robot named Bender... As him, I have a real problem with alcohol but don't worry I was programmed to be a barman."
Not an episodic game - We will offer you a unique and full adventure with Starflint the Blackhole Prophecy. No episodes but one complete game for your unique pleasure !
Beautiful Cartoon Style - Sleek and gorgeous hand drawn style. An authentic and beautiful cartoon-style adventure game. 24 frames per second like real movies for a smooth animations !
A Living World - The goal is for everything to be interactive, to reward players who poke and prod at every last item and object with insight, secrets, and humor.
Choosiness On A Massive Scale - Players will make choices which affect the game, the future dialogs with NPC and their story.
Multiple Protagonists - Trixie is a brilliant young retired secret agent, strong mentality, intuitive and the captain of a mercenaries spaceship. Flint is a... delivery man. He goes from job to odd jobs. His worst enemy... the alarm clock.
Multiple endings - You have the power to write the story, with complete freedom of approach and it's your choices which change the game. There will be a great replayability. Depending on your choices. Like on the Mass Effect games or Blade Runner point'n click game. Multiple possibilities and endings for Trixie and Flint during their journey!
Not For Kids - Complex relationships will be explored with themes of family, loss, and identity influenced by horror with blood contents, sci-fi, and mystery genres. StarFlint is an adult-themed video game. The player can make choices that will lead him to see some nude scenes.
A galaxy far far away - Explore the galaxy aboard your custom spaceship and with your alien crew. You will meet many intriguing and suspicious aliens characters, in an universe where races are multiple with their own culture. You will explore a wide range of planets, each different from the other, all even more dangerous than the other.
The executives will not be paid with the kickstarter, only artists will be.
A deadly space pirate named Trixie and Flint, a not very important dude, are poles apart. But, a strange blackhole changes Flint and makes him save Trixie and her crew. Indeed, the Order, a strange space dictatorial police, is after the space pirates. And for some not so obvious reasons. This encounter will alter the path of their destiny, make them meet a lot of alien species and force them to discover many mysteries and conspiracy.
Trixie is intuitive and fearless, she through herself in the land of freelancers. She's be rapidly wanted by a bunch of mobsters and few interstellar agencies. Surrounded by a tight and dedicated crew, eachone of them for his own reason, she's well renowned.
Flint is an ordinary man, locked in his daily life, without great ambition. He supported himself with odd jobs and only dare to escape dreaming of absurd greatness.
Our point'n click offers different purposes and choice to customize your adventure, include through meetings with various NPCs. We thus take into Mass Effect references, but we distinguish our project by his 2D cartoon style. We cover a broad range of topics that not be suitable for the younger audience. So we are developing this series with uncensored adult content that include nudity scenes.
The game will initially support PC / Mac and localized in French and English. We plan to add more platforms especially iOS and Android after the desktop version is released. We are also looking into the possibility of Steam and Console support and Linux but for now Unity 5 export is a little bit unstable and we will have to make some tests before, to be sure to provide you the best quality possible.
Everything is interactive! The animations aim to be cartoonish, the caracters movements are not repetitives but in full adequacy with their environments.
All this with a nice dose of humor, violence and sex.
You'll be prompted to customize your spaceship in order to accommodate more people, expand your crew and so, open up new possibility, side quests and new places to explore.
This is a game about your choices and how they permanently affect their story. We want to deliver a rich narrative experience about relationships with delightful surprises and interactions.
The NPC will remember you, what you have said to them and how you behaved with them. Following your choices, some will become friends and others, all the contrary, will try to trick you. Each decisions, choices or dialogs would have it importance and will have heavy consequences in certain cases. Death lurks, waiting its next visit.
All in all, it is more than 40 to 60 NPC what are waiting you and with whom you will be able to interact and dialog with. It is more than 60 colorfull and animated backgrounds.
StarFlint the Blackhole Prophecy is set in a futuristic world where humanity and the alien races coexist.
We were inspired by the science fiction movies from the 90's and 2000 as Firefly, Star Wars, H2G2, the fifth element, Gremlins, Back to the futur, Cowboy Bebop, where the characters are not all white or all black. They wear slinky outfits and where robots aned technologies are used for sciences, explorations and military fields.
By choosing this cartoon look, we discarded the heavy dramatic feel while keeping the originality and character related to science fiction. Our main cartoon inspiration are directly related to the point'n click game as The Curse Of Monkey Island, Day Of The Tentacle or the first episodes of the Broken Sword and games like Mass Effect. In addition, our game is intended for an adult audiences who does not want to be censored.
The cartoon look help us to enhance the feelings and the personalities of all our caracters. It help us to offer you animations in total adequacy with the surroundings and to manage lots of cutscenes in order to better tell you the story.
We want to create a real cartoon style animation games! Mixing the themes, we achive the artistic direction we desire for StarFlint the Blackhole Prophecy.
So why Kickstarter? Because we can’t do it alone... We need you! We need the help of a larger community in order to realize the dream of producing StarFlint. Video gaming is our passion and the wonderful Kickstarter community offers the possibility of creating a broader and deeper story than we have the resources to craft on our own.
For the past two years we've been doing our best to provide the BEST quality graphic EVER by searching talents and professionals all around the WORLD! We sent a thousand emails ! From Russia to Brazil through Africa !
We believe in this project more than anything !! And for this, we did not hesitate to wet the shirt !
We have designed environments and characters, outlined the story and the game is ready to be brought to life.
This is the game we've always wanted to play as a gamer. This is the project we've been excited to make for years, and now we are ready to transform that dream in a reality. But we can’t do it without your help!
"Suzanne Masson"

The plan is to have the game in alpha by winter '16. This would allow us to time to create final art, animation, sound, music, polish the game, and possibly add voice acting for a launch in Spring '17.
The game requires continued writing, storyboarding, design, game design, illustration, coding, modeling of sets, character rigging, character animation, sound design, music composition, and with the stretch goals, voice talent. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
To ensure us the success of the project, only artists will be paid. So, all the funds raised will only be used for the realisation, the improvement of the game and to pay the services of professionnals in fields that we do not master (Sounds, traductions, voice actings,...).

To minimise the risks, we have created Stunmason Games. A firme witch only goal is to realise Starflint. Doing so, we are able to pay less taxes and to only pay the accrued liabilities.

Every artists involved in the game are experienced in their fields. This knowledge and our analizes anable us to predict and anticipate all the aspects of the production. Our organisation is professionnal and we will fully respect the deadlines that we have set. Neither an artist nor a technician, I've managed a casino for nearly ten years in Montreal, Canada. I know how the respect a budget and avoid all unnecessary spendings/Costs. So I would be responsible for all administration and accounting. Another good point is that we do not work in an office which further reduces costs. All the money on the project really goes to basics.

To ensure a total success and a foolproof flexibility, we are using Unity 5 as video game engine. even if it doesn't need any introcuction, it is a powerful tool that allows us all fantasies at both animations and programming. The biggest benefits of using Unity are a trusted engine with a lot of 1st & 3rd­party support. More importantly, Unity is very flexible, and will make it much easier to support other platforms in the future including: iOS, Android, PS4, ONE...

Finaly, Unity 5 is coded in C#/javascript, a code that is fully mastered by our developper for nearly ten years. There is a high probability to have multiple mini­games in StarFlint the Blackhole Prophecy.

In the end, with the minimum requested, we make sure we can achieve at least the game above an average level eventhough without achieving all our goals. Our most epic challenge will make you dream through the adventures of Trixie and Flint.

Now, we are super thrilled and excited to announce the crowdfunding campaign of Starflint the blackhole prophecy hosted at kickstarter.com ! Please support us !!

Ben, 12 years old, comes home after school. Because of his poor grades in school, his mom locks him in his room for the rest of the day.
A few hours later, when everything is quiet in the house, an intruder breaks in and kidnaps his mother and his little brother.
Locked in his room, Ben is unable to help them.
What to do? Call the police? Call his dad?
Adventurous and full of courage, he starts to investigate by himself and plans to find out the cause of their kidnapping.
The scenario offers many surprises and you will spend many hours discovering the story of Ben, little clumsy kid trying to find his missing parents. His whimsical character will not make his life easier…
Ben, adolescent de 12 ans, rentre chez lui après ses cours d'école. Vu ses résultats déplorables à l'école, sa maman l'enferme pour le restant de la journée dans sa chambre.  
Quelques heures plus tard, alors que tout est calme dans la maison, un intrus s'introduit dans la maison, et kidnappe sa maman et son petit frère.  
Enfermé dans sa chambre, Ben n'arrive pas à les secourir.
Que faire ? Appeler la police ? Appeler son père ?
Téméraire et plein de courage, il décide de les chercher seul et découvrir la cause de l'enlèvement.
Le scénario promet multiples rebondissements et vous fera passer de nombreuses heures à découvrir l’aventure de Ben, petit gamin maladroit qui essaye de retrouver ses parents qui ont disparus. Doté d’un caractère capricieux, il vous en fera voir de toutes les couleurs…

The puzzles are designed to be logical and always relevant to the story. Forget the point and click games asking you to combine any pair of random items. Play naturally as if you were in place of the character.
Dialogues

campaign.story:
Hello Kickstarter,
I am Manuel Schenk and I would like to show you my new project „Nelson and the Magic Cauldron“, a classic point & click adventure game.
As a kid, I was inspired by adventure games created by Lucasarts and Sierra. The main parts of all these games are the story telling and beautiful graphics. During my childhood, I drew a lot and never really lost addiction. Later - as a hobby writer - I wrote a couple of books, including Fantasy stories, a Mystery- and a distopic Thriller and a very funny story. For me, there had to be a way to combine both passions. Stories with interesting characters and hand made graphics.
Windmill
This game takes place in a fantasy setting, where a young man called Nelson inherits a cabin from his deceased uncle Sid, not knowing, that the uncle was a necromancer during his lifetime. Most places in the game can be visited at day and night time, some of them only at night, where you can meet very interesting characters. There will be a lot of puzzles and crazy characters, including dead uncle Sid – who will appear as a ghost-, the stone cold undertaker, the confused baron, the soup-cooking witches, a group of game addicted skeletons and the vegan zombies.
So this will be a game of magic and a lot of humor – with many hidden jokes about other games and movies – as a homage, of course.
From Sketch to Color
The prototype of the game has been created with Unity and the Adventure Creator Plugin.
During the last two years, I did a couple of smaller game projects and prototypes with Unity. Last year, I released the digital version of a German board game on steam and on mobile platforms.
For my new adventure game I have to do a lot of drawing and animation work. This – including additional scripting - will be completely done by myself. The soundtrack and all the soundeffects will be created by a friend of mine, who created the music for my earlier projects.
Depending on the stretch goals, the game could be released late 2017.
Village at night
If you support this game, you will receive a DRM free download for PC, Mac and Linux. There will be some further options for purchasing the soundtrack or a digital artbook. But you can also become a part of this game as a character by sending me a picture of you. I will draw a comic version of yourself and put you in the game.
Another interesting way of being a part of this adventure is to be a co-producer. Your name could be put in the credits and even in the intro of the game.
There are also some stretch goals including a talkie version and a complete novel – both in English and German. Mobile versions for iOS and Android could be possible, too. But this can only be done with your help.
Windmill at night
I need your support to create this classic point & click adventure game and I need your criticism, too. Please support „Nelson and the Magic Cauldron“, to make a game possible, that we all love.
Thank you.
